  • Experience in working with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and ability to set work priorities
  • Good business sense and logical thinking. Ability to synthesize quantitative information and articulate concrete concepts to others.
  • Experience with financial trading, risk and derivatives analysis will be beneficial

Our recruitment philosophy

We value self-awareness in our recruitment process. We seek people who understand themselves and their career goals. We're after those with the right skills and a conscious choice to join our field. The perfect fit? A crypto enthusiast who’s driven, collaborative, and delivers solid, scalable outcomes.

Our offer

  • A competitive salary package, with various benefits depending on the method of engagement (employee or freelancer).
  • Autonomy in your time management thanks to flexible working hours and the opportunity to work remotely
  • The freedom to create your own entrepreneurial experience by being part of a team of people in search of excellence

As an employer we are committed to build an inclusive, diverse and non-discriminating work environment. We welcome employees of all backgrounds, ethnicities, genders, creed and sexual orientation. We hire, reward and promote entirely based on merit and performance.

Due to the nature of our business and external requirements, we perform background checks on all potential employees, passing which is a prerequisite to join Keyrock.

Title: Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
The PACE Flight Operations Team is currently looking for a Data Engineer / Data Analyst (m/f/d). The position is a full-time position, to be held in Berlin, Germany. In that role you are part of a team, that is developing a new product in the field of civil aviation. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data analysis, data engineering, and a keen interest in the aviation or flight operations domain. You will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting complex datasets related to flight operations and -performance. Your insights will help drive strategic decisions and innovations in our application. Be part of making the aviation more efficient!

Responsibilities & Job Description


You are responsible for the data analytics of our Flight Profile Optimizer
You will maintain and re-new the necessary infrastructure
You collect, process, and analyze large datasets from various sources, including flight data, maintenance records, and operational logs.
You develop and maintain data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure data integrity and accessibility.
You perform statistical analysis and create and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders and customers
You collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, product owners, and aviation experts, to understand data requirements and deliver actionable insights.
You ensure data quality and implement best practices for data governance and stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in data analysis and aviation technology.



Required Qualifications

Mandatory


You hold a bachelor’s or master’s degree in data science, computer science, statistics, engineering, or a related field.
You have at least 3 years of experience as a data engineer or data analyst
You have proven experience as a data analyst, data engineer, or similar role, preferably in the aviation domain.
You are proficient in data analysis tools and programming languages such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau or Power BI.
You have experience with big data technologies and platforms (e.g., Snowflake, AWS, Azure)
You have strong analytical skills and attention to detail.
You are excellent in communication and collaboration skills.
You are able to work independently and manage multiple projects simultaneously.



Desired


You understand flight operations, aircraft systems and maintenance procedures
You have a good mathematical understanding
An aerospace background is a plus
Experience with flight data monitoring (FDM) and analysis.
An AWS certificate is a plus
Familiarity with machine learning techniques and tools.



Behavioral skills


You have a solution-oriented mindset
You are a fast learner and able to work independently / with own responsibility



We offer


An interesting job in the aerospace industry with direct interaction with many leading aerospace companies
Working with very talented and passionate people in a professional environment.
International projects with the opportunity to gain deep domain knowledge and expertise.
A modern office with top-of-the-line equipment, situated in the historic Westend train station with great transport accessibility.
Employee discounts from top suppliers from different business areas
Flexibility to work from home
A comprehensive compensation package
20 days per year of mobile working from other EU countries



If you find this position interesting, please send us your cover letter, CV, certificates and references.

Title: Climate Change Analyst | Carbon Footprinting, Data Insights | Berlin
Description:
My client is an innovative tech-for-good start-up based in Berlin. With almost a third of global greenhouse gases coming from food production, this cutting-edge software provider is at the forefront of the solution securing funding of over €10 million in just 2 years. They require a Business Analyst to help their clients understand the climate data insights in order to set an accurate and achievable Net Zero target.

The role


Conduct calculations to work out carbon footprints for several different clients
Work closely with their client base ensuring accurate data collection, calculations and data analysis
Produce insights from the calculations to be used for Net Zero target plans
Keeping up to date with the latest environmental regulations and protocols
Create “products” from the calculations to offer the same service to future clients


Skills And Experience Required


At least 3 years’ experience with client facing positions
Previous experience in consulting start-ups (or other fast paced environments)
Strong skills in complex datasets and quantitative analysis
Any experience in carbon footprint calculations would be valuable
Fluent in both German and English


In Return, They Can Offer


A salary of up to €80k depending on experience
Generous benefits package
Top of the range city centre office


If this role sounds of interest, feel free to apply or reach out to Luke Rose directly!

Title: Junior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Bitly, we believe in the power of the link or scan - to start a conversation, build a relationship or grow a business. Our mission is to turn every interaction into a catalyst for connections. It’s what motivates us to help people share, promote and engage everywhere on the Internet. We do this by being relentlessly product-focused, fostering the free-flowing exchange of ideas, and inspiring people around the world to dream up new ways of using Bitly.

The Role

Bitly is seeking a skilled Jr. Data Engineer to join the Engineering team and be a key player in supporting our data infrastructure and pipeline. As a Junior Data Engineer at Bitly, you will help to architect, build and maintain infrastructure responsible for delivering data to customers, as well as transforming our petabytes of global traffic data into useful and timely insights. You will be a part of a global team that builds a Data Platform to not only provide Data into a global DWH but also supports companywide tools with operational data.

The Data Platform team maintains many of the data pipelines that power our internal teams, making this a key role inside the company. Bitly supports every country in the world and every platform imaginable. Our systems are built to process an enormous amount of data. To support our scale, our infrastructure consists of hundreds of servers, dozens of services, and numerous real-time data streams. You will work with Senior Data Engineers and receive great team support and growth opportunities.

What You'll Do


Write well-tested, well-documented code
Help to build major new services and improve existing ones
Create pipelines to move and transform data efficiently
Design flexible internal and external APIs to expose our data
Work with a variety of data tools, both cloud-based and internal


Who You Are


Fluent in English
Solid understanding of SQL and good grasp of relational and analytical database management theory and practice.
Good knowledge of Python
Excellent verbal and written communication skills to be able to interact with technical and business counterparts.
Active listener.
Strong analytical and problem solving abilities.
Lots of curiosity. You never stop learning new things.
Creativity. We love to be surprised with innovative solutions
Be a team worker with a positive attitude
Experience with Go (Golang)
Experience with Scrum
Experience with BI and visualization tools
Experience with Terraform


What Bitly offers on Day 1!


Competitive Salary + Stock Options
30 days paid vacation
Flexible working location
Robust mental health support and Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Impactful connections and community building through our Employee Resource Groups
Global DEI programming
Company-sponsored events to connect Bitizens together


Eligibility & Closing

Applicants must be currently authorized to work in Germany on a full-time basis and located in Germany.

Compensation

The salary range for this role takes into account a wide range of factors considered in making compensation decisions including, but not limited to, skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications as well as other business and organizational needs.

Base Salary Range

€48.000—€66.000 EUR

Our Values


Be a Catalyst. As an innovative technology company, we build our products to be a catalyst for connection and encourage our team to be catalysts for meaningful impact both at work and in the world
Take Ownership. In our highly collaborative culture, Individual accountability is critical. We depend on each other to solve our customers' most challenging problems and celebrate the wins together
Champion Diversity, Equity & Inclusion. Our product connects people of all backgrounds and abilities. And our company is built on the belief that our differences make us better and that everyone deserves the opportunity in which to thrive
Show Integrity. We don’t cut corners. We don’t look for the easy way out. We approach every day with a shared mindset - let’s do the right thing, even if it’s the harder thing
Have Fun. Whether your time is here is as short as a Bitly link or as long as the links your grandma sends you, we want your experience at Bitly to be fun and memorable. We hope the connections you make here last a lifetime


In keeping with our beliefs and goals, no employee or applicant will face discrimination or harassment based on: race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, age, gender, marital domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, or veteran status. Above and beyond discrimination/harassment based on “protected categories,” Bitly also strives to prevent other, subtler forms of inappropriate behavior (e.g., stereotyping) from ever gaining a foothold in our office. Whether blatant or hidden, barriers to success have no place at Bitly.


Show more

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Analytics (all genders)
Description:
You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando’s Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Analytics team, you will put customer data at the core of our decisions and processes.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



You derive actionable customer insights and recommendations to fuel our Zalando business and the customer strategy. Your insights are derived from deep dive analysis you perform using a broad range of analytical methods and visualisations applied to data from various sources (transactional data, onsite data etc)
You proactively share your insights and recommendations in regular business reviews to senior management by providing compelling visualisations and stories. You seek opportunities to spread the insights beyond regular touchpoints with the aim of sourcing new business opportunities
You develop and optimise forecasting models for key customer metrics and provide expertise on current and expected trends for central planning efforts in close collaboration with our commercial planning teams
You drive analytical and data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members
You effectively collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers to untap new sources of data and know how



What We’re Looking For



5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in Google Analytics (BigQuery), MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github. Knowledge of basic time series forecasting techniques (SARIMAX, Prophet, Covariates) is considered a plus
Strong communication and visualisation skills and the ability to translate complex datasets into understandable and actionable insights and present to senior management in order to impact their decisions and strategy
Being curious and proactively creating insights while demonstrating end to end ownership of analytical projects. You innovate on new methodologies and datasets but also have a good sense when an pragmatic solution is sufficient
You are a role model and proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here’s an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE)
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
AI Platform Engineer

An exciting biotech company dedicated to discovering and developing medicines for neurological disorders specifically within the small molecule space is looking for a new AI based Platform Engineer to join their growing team on a hybrid/remote basis.




Responsibilities:

Collaborate with the AI team to set project goals, develop strategic plans, and create product roadmaps.
Understand platform components to guide decisions and enhance scalability and interoperability.
Apply MLOps principles to transition machine learning models to production.
Write production-quality code, maintain documentation, and report progress.




Required Skills and Experience:

Advanced Python skills, with knowledge of Tensorflow, PyTorch, and Pandas.
Experience in ETL processes, data modeling, data architecture, and data pipeline development.
Proficiency with graph databases (e.g., RDF, Neo4j) and query languages (e.g., SPARQL, Cypher); knowledge of relational databases is a plus.
Proven experience deploying machine learning models, especially in NLP or deep learning, in production.
Ability to work independently within a cross-functional team.
2-3 years of industry experience, preferably in life sciences.
[Preferred] Experience with life science/drug discovery data and biomedical ontologies.
[Preferred] Ability to collaborate with data scientists, data architects, bioinformaticians, and cheminformaticians.

Title: Staff Data Analyst - Digital Tracking (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.


Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access, and wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!


#data

JR101627
Show more
HTML:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You’ll Do

  • Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
  • Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
  • Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
  • Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
  • Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
  • Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
  • Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams

What You'll Bring

  • Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
  • Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
  • Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
  • Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
  • Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
  • Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
  • Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
  • A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
  • You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

What We Offer

Elevate your lifestyle! Join one of Europe's fastest-growing tech powerhouses in a dynamic phase of expansion.

  • Immerse yourself in a diverse global community of 90+ nationalities.
  • Enjoy a competitive compensation package that goes beyond the norm, with perks like a HelloFresh- subsidized Pension Scheme, Berlin relocation support, and a Hybrid working model.
  • Elevate your lifestyle with exclusive discounts on your weekly HelloFresh box and office meals.
  • Invest in your growth with an annual learning & development budget, German language learning budget, and access to the HelloFresh Academy.
  • Plus, we've got your well-being covered with mental health support, transportation perks, and working-parent-friendly benefits. From our 24/7 gym access, and wellbeing platforms like Headspace and Spill, to sabbatical leave options, HelloFresh is not just a workplace; it's a lifestyle of perks and possibilities!

Title: Junior Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
For our headquarters in Berlin Prenzlauer-Berg, we are looking to have you on-board as our new:

Junior Data Engineer (m/f/d)




Our Data Platform team enables data-driven decision-making at home24 and our partners by developing impactful data products with end-to-end responsibility from data integration to dashboards and data science applications. As part of our growing team, you'll work on an exciting new project, making it an ideal time to welcome you to our team.




Your Responsibilities

Collaborate with your team members to design, implement and maintain data processing pipelines in different clouds (AWS and Azure)
Assist in defining the vision and objectives for data products by working closely with product managers, analysts, and other team members
Support analysts in developing high-performing and insightful dashboards by providing necessary data infrastructure
Implement automated monitoring tools to ensure data accuracy and reliability
Engage proactively with cross-functional teams to identify and implement pragmatic solutions to business problems
Contribute to the continuous improvement of data engineering processes and best practices




Your Profile

If you're interested in the role, but don't meet every requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We value a willingness to learn and grow with us. Tell us why you’re the right person in your application.

University degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or a related area
First experience working on projects using Python or Scala with data processing frameworks
Understanding of SQL
A passion for emerging technologies
Understanding of data modeling concepts
Experience with the AWS or Azure clouds
Experience in e-commerce is a plus




What We Offer You

Your impact

The chance to make an impact in a highly motivated team of professionals
An open-minded culture ready to incorporate new and creative ideas

Your growth

Mentoring and support from experienced colleagues
Extensive learning opportunities from our home24 academy and external partners
Room for growth and development within your role through regular feedback rounds

Your path

Hybrid working model: you have the flexibility to work from home on Wednesdays and Fridays in our standard working mode. We are in the office together Mondays, Tuesdays and Thursdays
The possibility to work up to two months per year within Germany or from an EU country
Up to 30 days paid vacation each year to unwind and recharge
City mobility with a subsidized public transportation ticket and our eco-friendly bike leasing program #ridinghome

Your second home

International campus in the heart of Berlin featuring drive-in bicycle garage, outdoor space and lounge areas, fitness facilities, parent and multi-faith rooms close to the Berlin S-Bahn train station Landsberger Allee
Company benefits including a pension scheme, 30 % off the home24 assortment, and employee discounts at partner organizations
You want to learn more about our home24 company culture and what it is like to be a homie? Follow @teamhome24 on Instagram




If you want to become part of a thrilling success story – we are looking forward to your application. Please send us your resume, cover letter and all relevant documents together with your salary expectations and the earliest possible starting date via our career site.




Your home is surely filled with furniture of varying materials and styles. The same is true for home24 as an employer. We celebrate the diversity of the people who work with us. Be who you are and feel welcome to #makeyourselfathome24




You can find all job offers on our career site !




home24 SE | Otto-Ostrowski-Straße 3 | 10249 Berlin | Contact: Nadine Scharf

Title: Data Analyst VII (f/m/d)
Description:
GOhiring is the leading software company for automated job posting and recruiting analytics. With our tool, recruiters can manage the entire job posting process in one place – from data-driven multiposting campaigns to in-depth analysis along the candidate journey. We help recruiters make the most out of their online job postings.




Your role

Developing analyses, visualisations, and reporting for internal and external clients
Creating and tuning dashboards, using Power BI, that visualise and analyse data from HR processes
Automating reports and data transformations with Airflow
Gathering and defining data pipeline requirements
Managing the scalability and rollout of our analytics dashboards
Grow with your role




Your profile

BSc or MSc in a data-oriented field of studies or statistics
2+ years of professional experience in a similar role
Profound experience with SQL, PowerBI, and Data Modeling
Proven track record of hands-on development of PowerBI dashboards
Experience with an orchestration tool, preferably Airflow
Experience with Data Visualization
Ideally, experience with embedded PowerBI solutions or capacity planning
You are curious about the data world and are not afraid to ask questions and like to research to find solutions to arising challenges
The quality of your work is important to you
Interest in growing and learning with a team long-term
Fluent in English




We offer

Remote Work: Work from where you are most productive - be it at home, while traveling or in our office in Berlin.
Flexibility: Look forward to processes and mindsets that are 100% geared towards time-flexible and location-independent work.
Making a big difference in a small team: We believe that small teams are more fun. Direct collaboration, lots of creative freedom, learning from each other - that's our understanding of productivity.
More than a job - discovering the future: You'll work at the heart of digitalization in recruiting and perhaps discover the job of a lifetime.
Choose your device - we pay: For your remote job you’ll get a laptop and a technical setup of your choice.
World-class team and onboarding: Your team members Lucas and Rémy will guide you through our hands-on onboarding, so you feel in good hands from the very beginning. Here you can meet the team.
Two Offsites a year: Twice a year you will spend a week with all your coworkers in different locations within Europe.
Keep growing: Take advantage of our training opportunities using various training platforms.




Want to work together on the future of recruiting?

Simply send us your CV or LinkedIn / Xing profile. No cover letter needed. We are happy to hear from you. Diversity and equal opportunity are very important to us. We are happy about the interest of all candidates and strive to provide feedback as quickly as possible.

Title: Senior Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are seeking an organised and self-motivated Data Analyst to work embedded in our Marketing Data team, one of our cross-functional Data teams to help shape the development of one of the world's leading FinTech products.

As a Senior Data Analyst you will enable our Marketing team to make data-driven decisions. You will monitor, measure and analyse the effectiveness of your marketing teams’ initiatives, as well as help drive the strategy of your stakeholder teams. You are here to establish a data-mindset and thereby to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You will work in a cross functional setup, working closely with other analysts, engineers, scientists and marketing managers.

In This Role, You Will


Help us set the right goals: Develop clear and measurable targets based on an initiatives’ scope.
Be a strategic partner for Senior Leadership: Driving end to end high complexity analysis on a strategic level in which the business domain is critical to drive overall company success.
Stakeholder management: Be an internal go-to-person for your teams when it comes to data related questions.
Evaluate initiatives: Support Marketing experimentation & testing initiatives; design test plans, obtain cross-functional alignment, execute robust analysis, and deliver actionable insights. Share these learnings through clear documentation and concise and empathic communication.
Contribute to self-serve data platform: Help building the right analytics foundations ,by pairing up with technical peers, so our marketing teams can interact with data and extract the right insights themselves.
Provide monitoring tools: Build the dashboards your team looks at every week to make sure they are impacting our company OKRs.
Improve data literacy of organisation: Educate teams to become independent when it comes to data access and understanding function led training and team wide workshops to foster data driven culture.
Be part of our data-community: Collaborate with a broad range of analytics teams at N26 to utilise shared platforms, insights and innovations.


What You Need To Be Successful


5+ years of experience, within the Marketing or Product Analytics field.
Strong understanding of statistical methods used in the analysis of experimental and observational data.Highly experienced with SQL and Python/R for analytics
Experience working with one or more common data visualisation tools (Tableau, Metabase, Looker, Superset, etc)Good presentation skills and communication skills.
Having experience in high growth startups managing topics like lifecycle, marketing strategy, engagement or subscription would be a plus.
Experience with Customer Data Platforms (eg. Braze, Treasure Data) would be a plus.
Having experience in quantitative research would be a plus.
Having experience in fintech would be a plus.


What’s In It For You


Accelerate your career growth by joining one of Europe’s most talked about disruptors 🚀.
Employee benefits that range from a competitive personal development budget, work from home budget, discounts to fitness & wellness memberships, language apps and public transportation.
As an N26 employee you will have access to a Premium subscription on your personal N26 bank account. As well as subscriptions for friends and family members.
Vacation days vary depending on your location of work. Additional day of annual leave for each year of service.
A high degree of autonomy and access to cutting edge technologies - all while working with a friendly team of peers of diverse nationalities, life experiences and family statuses.
A relocation package with visa support for those who need it.


Who We Are

N26 has reimagined banking for today’s digital world. Technology and design empower everything we do and it’s how we are building the global banking platform the world loves to use.

We've eliminated physical branches, paperwork, and hidden fees for an elegant digital experience and supreme savings. Giving people the power to live and bank their way is what gets us out of bed in the morning and inspires the work that we do.

Founded in 2013, N26 now has more than 8 million customers in 24 markets. We are headquartered in Berlin with offices in multiple cities across Europe, including Vienna and Barcelona, and a 1,500-strong team of more than 80 nationalities.

Sounds good? Apply now for this position.

N26 is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
GETEC ist einer der führenden Energieversorger und Contracting-Spezialisten für Industrie und Immobilienwirtschaft in Europa. Unser Werteversprechen "Wir haben die Energie für mehr" ist Leitbild für über 2.400 Mitarbeiter, die mit exzellentem Engineering-Know-how, herausragender regulatorischer Kompetenz, ausgewiesener Handlungsschnelligkeit und umfassender Nachhaltigkeitsexpertise unsere Kunden durch eine immer komplexer werdende Energiewelt navigieren.

Deine zukünftige Aufgabe

Wir vertrauen auf Deine Expertise, wenn es um die Lieferantenqualifizierung und -verwaltung innerhalb der internen Systeme geht.
Die systemübergreifende Analyse und Weiterentwicklung der Datenlandschaft, um Datenverfügbarkeit und Transparenz zu gewährleisten (PLM, ERP) gehören ebenfalls zu Deinen Aufgaben.
Du erstellst Datenbanken und entwirfst Visualisierungen, die es dem Projektteam ermöglichen, mit fortschrittlichen Analysetools (PowerBI) zu arbeiten.
Um Reibungen und Potenziale zu verstehen, schlägst Du im engen Kontakt mit Prozess- und Methodenexperten KI-Anwendungen innerhalb des GETEC-Einkaufs vor und treibst die Nutzung von KI an.
Du bist für die Aufrechterhaltung und Überprüfung der Datenqualität, Harmonisierung und Konsolidierung zuständig.
Das Durchführen von Schulungen und Demos für PowerBI und vergleichbare Tools rundet Dein Aufgabengebiet ab.


Du als Mensch und was Du mitbringst

Bachelor-Abschluss mit Schwerpunkt Wirtschaftsinformatik oder einen vergleichbaren Studiengang
Mindestens 5 Jahre Erfahrung in der Datenanalyse von großen Daten und Simulationen
Vorerfahrung im Einkauf, der Versicherungsbranche oder dem Bankwesen von Vorteil
Ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse in PowerBI, MS Office und verschiedenen ERP-Systemen
Ausgeprägte analytische und methodische Fähigkeiten sowie hohes Maß an Genauigkeit und Qualität
Strukturierte Arbeitsmethoden und hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und proaktiver Arbeitsweise
Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse zwingend erforderlich


Wir bieten MEHR

Du hast bei uns die Möglichkeit, die Energiewende aktiv mitzugestalten.
Ab Tag Eins bist Du Teil des Teams und hast die Chance direkt Verantwortung zu übernehmen.
Wir ermöglichen Dir eine gute Work-Life-Balance durch eine flexible Arbeitszeitplanung mit Gleitzeit sowie 30 Urlaubstagen im Jahr.
Wir bieten unseren Mitarbeitern das Jobrad-Konzept: 365 Tage im Jahr fit halten und zusätzlich die Umwelt schonen.
Freue Dich auf die Nutzung zahlreicher Fitness- und Wellness-Angebote bei einer Mitgliedschaft über unseren Kooperationspartner Hansefit.
Du möchtest Dich weiterentwickeln? Nutze deinen kostenlosen Zugang zu LinkedIn Learning und bekomme Zugriff auf unzählige Trainings- und Lernvideos. Zudem bieten wir eine Vielzahl von internen und externen Weiterbildungs- und Coaching-Angeboten an.
Die Atmosphäre ist Dir wichtig? – Agiles Arbeiten und moderne Bürokonzepte sind für uns eine Selbstverständlichkeit.
Durch unser Corporate Benefit Portal erhältst Du Zugang zu verschiedenen Vergünstigungen bei über 800 namhaften Produkt- und Eventanbietern.


Wir laden alle Menschen herzlich dazu ein, Teil der GETEC-Familie zu werden und unsere offene und wertschätzende Unternehmenskultur zu erleben. Wir sind überzeugt, dass jeder Einzelne von uns einen Beitrag zur Energiewende leisten kann. Es spielt dabei keine Rolle, woher Du kommst, welches Geschlecht oder welche sexuelle Orientierung Du hast, welchem Glauben Du angehörst oder ob Du Einschränkungen hast.
Das GETEC Recruiting Team freut sich auf Deine Kontaktaufnahme und Deine Bewerbung:
MAKING A DIFFERENCE FOR GENERATIONS TO COME.
Show more

  • Ausgezeichnete Kenntnisse in PowerBI, MS Office und verschiedenen ERP-Systemen
  • Ausgeprägte analytische und methodische Fähigkeiten sowie hohes Maß an Genauigkeit und Qualität
  • Strukturierte Arbeitsmethoden und hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und proaktiver Arbeitsweise
  • Verhandlungssichere Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse zwingend erforderlich

Wir bieten MEHR
  • Du hast bei uns die Möglichkeit, die Energiewende aktiv mitzugestalten.
  • Ab Tag Eins bist Du Teil des Teams und hast die Chance direkt Verantwortung zu übernehmen.
  • Wir ermöglichen Dir eine gute Work-Life-Balance durch eine flexible Arbeitszeitplanung mit Gleitzeit sowie 30 Urlaubstagen im Jahr.
  • Wir bieten unseren Mitarbeitern das Jobrad-Konzept: 365 Tage im Jahr fit halten und zusätzlich die Umwelt schonen.
  • Freue Dich auf die Nutzung zahlreicher Fitness- und Wellness-Angebote bei einer Mitgliedschaft über unseren Kooperationspartner Hansefit.
  • Du möchtest Dich weiterentwickeln? Nutze deinen kostenlosen Zugang zu LinkedIn Learning und bekomme Zugriff auf unzählige Trainings- und Lernvideos. Zudem bieten wir eine Vielzahl von internen und externen Weiterbildungs- und Coaching-Angeboten an.
  • Die Atmosphäre ist Dir wichtig? – Agiles Arbeiten und moderne Bürokonzepte sind für uns eine Selbstverständlichkeit.
  • Durch unser Corporate Benefit Portal erhältst Du Zugang zu verschiedenen Vergünstigungen bei über 800 namhaften Produkt- und Eventanbietern.

Wir laden alle Menschen herzlich dazu ein, Teil der GETEC-Familie zu werden und unsere offene und wertschätzende Unternehmenskultur zu erleben. Wir sind überzeugt, dass jeder Einzelne von uns einen Beitrag zur Energiewende leisten kann. Es spielt dabei keine Rolle, woher Du kommst, welches Geschlecht oder welche sexuelle Orientierung Du hast, welchem Glauben Du angehörst oder ob Du Einschränkungen hast.
Das GETEC Recruiting Team freut sich auf Deine Kontaktaufnahme und Deine Bewerbung:
MAKING A DIFFERENCE FOR GENERATIONS TO COME.

Title: Data Engineer (f/m/d)
Description:
Your mission

VisionAI is a fast-growing AI startup based in Berlin & London and we are at the forefront of reshaping online retail through innovative AI technologies. We're on a mission to level the playing field, providing intelligent tools that empower all online retailers with data-based decision-making capabilities, not just giants like Amazon. Our expert founding team comprises former online retailers and data scientists, who are committed to bringing e-commerce into the future, today.

About Our Mission

Every online retailer deserves access to the latest AI technologies, regardless of size or customer data. Our strong data and research background allows us to pioneer new methods in visual AI, expanding the application possibilities of these technologies.

Our tools help customers grow revenue, increase customer satisfaction and reduce the cost of operating all with the click of a button.

Join the Rebellion and become a vital part of VisionAI!

Role expectations: What you’ll be responsible for


Design, build, and maintain scalable data pipelines that support a wide range of data consumers, from internal teams focused on optimization to external platforms showcasing our platform's impact.
Collaborate closely with software engineers, AI researchers, and business stakeholders to gather requirements and deliver tailored, scalable data solutions.
Implement robust data warehousing solutions to ensure secure and efficient data storage and retrieval, supporting various analytical and operational needs.
Develop tools and systems to monitor, analyze, and improve data quality, ensuring that our data is reliable and accurate for all use cases.
Contribute to the expansion of our platform’s data-driven features, empowering customers with in-depth insights into their teams’ productivity and other key metrics.


Your profile

Your profile: What We Are Expecting From You In This Role


Demonstrated experience in data engineering, with a solid understanding of data structures, algorithms, and system design.
Nice to have could be a degree in Computer Science, Engineering or similar - however, we mainly care about your skills & experience in that field, not your degree
Proficiency in programming languages relevant to data engineering, such as Python, Scala, or Java.
Hands-on experience with big data tools (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data pipeline orchestration tools (e.g. Argo Workflows).
Proficiency in designing, implementing, and managing databases, including experience with SQL and NoSQL databases (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Neo4j).
A proactive approach to ensuring data quality and reliability, with a commitment to continuous improvement and innovation.


Why us?

As part of the VisionAI team, you will be looked after with some great benefits including:


Supportive Team: Be a key player in our engineering team and help achieve the next step towards our long term product vision. Collaborate with passionate and supportive colleagues, celebrating successes together and learning from challenges.
Diversity & Inclusion at Our Core: We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. At VisionAI, we believe that having diverse teams where everyone can bring their whole self to work is key to our success. We celebrate all backgrounds, experiences, abilities, and perspectives.
Work-Life Balance: We understand the importance of work-life balance and offer flexible working arrangements to support your personal and professional life: Whether it is flexible working hours or working from home when you need it. Oh and by the way: Longing for sunshine in the fall? Take advantage of a workation and work from a sunny location anywhere in europe.
Vibrant Office Space: Our office isn’t just a place to work—it’s a hub of activity and connection! Enjoy our team-space, daily lunches, our office gym, regular team-events and our vibrant office culture whenever you feel like it.
Professional Development: We are committed to your growth, offering ongoing training and development opportunities. You’ll have the chance to influence processes, learn new technologies, and advance your career.
Top-Notch Equipment: Receive a new MacBook, headphones and other essential tools to excel in your role.
Feel-Good Guarantee & Culture: We prioritize openness, fun, and community. Enjoy drinks, social events, and feel free to bring your dog to the office.


About Us

VisionAI is a fast-growing AI startup based in Bielefeld and London. We are leading online commerce into a new era with the help of AI technologies. We transform e-commerce with the help of intelligent tools and give our customers a competitive advantage through data-based decisions. We bring e-commerce stores into the AI age and enable online retailers to keep up with the giants around Amazon & Co.

About us: Our team consists of former e-commerce retailers and data scientists who are convinced that online retailers should have access to the latest AI technologies to make the store experience an exceptional one for their customers.

Through our strong research background, we are able to develop new methods in the field of visual AI and manage to expand the possibilities of these technologies and bring them into application.

Title: Data Analyst - FinTech (w/m/d)
Description:
Finmas ist DER digitale Partner der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe. Unsere Kund:innen sind Sparkassen, Landesbausparkassen und Versicherer in ganz Deutschland. Für sie entwickeln wir digitale Finanzmarktplätze für Immobilienfinanzierungen und Privatkredite in der Sparkassenwelt. Wir helfen ihnen, die Wünsche ihrer Kund:innen nach einer passenden Finanzierungslösung zu erfüllen. Neben der Baufinanzierung der Zukunft ist für uns die Vernetzung von Immobilie und Finanzierung maßgeblich, damit die Kund:innen der Sparkassen-Finanzgruppe vollumfänglich im Ökosystem „Wohnen & Leben“ begleitet werden.

Du hast Lust bekommen, Teil der Finmas zu werden und bist ein Data Analyst (w/m/d) und brennst für abwechslungsreiche Projekte in unserem FinTech? Dir sind Selbstverantwortung gepaart mit Selbstorganisation und eine Vielfalt in deinen Aufgaben wichtig?




Dann bewirb dich bei uns! Wir suchen zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt am Standort Berlin (mit der Option auf mobiles Arbeiten) eine:n Data Analyst:in (w/m/d)!




Das ist dein Spielfeld




Du entwickelst Dashboards und interne Reportings in Power BI, um datenbasierte Entscheidungen zu treffen und Geschäftsprozesse zu verbessern.
Du arbeitest eng mit den Fachbereichen zusammen, um ihre Anforderungen zu verstehen und zu erfüllen.
Du hilfst dabei unsere internen Dashboards von Qlik nach Power BI zu migrieren.
Du wirkst in spannenden Projekten mit und übernimmst dabei nach und nach Verantwortung für die Weiterentwicklung unserer Kundendashboards in Finmas Connect.
Du stehst sowohl unseren Kunden als auch internen Kolleginnen und Kollegen kompetent zur Seite, wenn es um Fragen rund um Daten und Dashboards geht.
Du nutzt mit der Azure Architektur (Power BI, Azure Data Factory, Azure SQL) einen modernen Tech Stack für deine tägliche Arbeit.




Das kannst du




Grundlage bildet dein abgeschlossenes Studium mit den Schwerpunkten Mathematik, Controlling, Statistik, Business Intelligence, Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen, Wirtschaftsinformatik, o.ä.
Du hast Erfahrung mit BI-Tools, insbesondere Power BI, und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Dashboards und Reportings zu erstellen.
Du hast grundlegende SQL-Kenntnisse, so dass du dir nötige Daten aus unserer Azure SQL Datenbank eigenständig zusammenstellen kannst.
Idealerweise bringst du praktische Erfahrungen in der Programmierung (Python) mit und hast Kenntnisse in der Anwendung von Data Science Methoden und Machine Learning Algorithmen.
Du hast eine hohe Affinität zu digitalen Themen und Geschäftsprozessen.
Du verfügst über Deutschkenntnisse auf mind. C1 Level in Wort und Schrift.




Das können wir




Wir bieten dir Freiraum und Unterstützung für deine individuelle persönliche und fachliche Entwicklung an
Vertrauensarbeitszeit, mobiles Arbeiten, Sabbaticals, flexible Planung deiner 30 Urlaubstage und die Option deinen Urlaub um 20 Tage zu erweitern
Es gibt bei uns attraktive Benefits von After-Work-Partys über Sportprogramme bis hin zu kostenlosen Getränken und Snacks – vielleicht können wir dich aber auch mit unserem Fitnessraum begeistern
Sportangebote, Teamevents, Finanzprodukte zu Sonderkonditionen, Mitarbeitendenrabatte, geförderte Altersvorsorge, Kooperation mit Kitas uvm.
Wir bieten dir eine abwechslungsreiche Mischung aus Arbeit in unserem modernen Büro in der Nähe des Hauptbahnhofes und remote Arbeit.




Du hast Lust, mit uns durchzustarten?




Bewerben kannst du dich ganz entspannt über unsere Webseite. Da musst du keine langen Formulare ausfüllen. Einfach deine Dokumente hochladen und fertig. Sogar auf das klassische Anschreiben kannst du bei uns gerne verzichten, viel spannender finden wir es, wenn du uns deine Motivation für die Stelle in ein paar Sätzen näher bringst oder Referenzprojekte anhängst




Bei Fragen wende Dich bitte an:




Lara Collina Piriz

Talent Acquisition Partnerin




E-Mail: lara.collina-piriz@hypoport.de

Hypoport SE | Finmas GmbH

www.hypoport.de | www.finmas.de




Show more

Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
About The Job

We are looking for a highly skilled Senior Business Intelligence Analyst (m/f/d) to join our portfolio company in the heart of Berlin.

In your day-to-day work, you'll focus on defining and executing the data model and strategy analysis, take the lead in tool and system innovations, and contribute to various projects.

Join our portfolio company: Founded in 2021 with its HQ in Berlin/Germany, the company runs a trailblazing marketplace that redefines one of the largest supply chains on earth. The company’s mission is to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing global access to high-quality products through its innovative platform. Since its launch in January 2022, the firm has operated discreetly with no public profile or media coverage while it has already successfully served hundreds of companies.

In this role, you’ll:


Lead the development and maintenance of the company’s BI structure to support strategic business initiatives
Conduct complex data analysis to extract deep insights and trends that drive business growth and operational efficiency
Create advanced dashboards, reports, and visualizations that facilitate data-driven decision-making at all levels of the organization
Act as a strategic partner to senior management and department heads, understanding their data needs and delivering actionable intelligence
Facilitate data-driven discussions and workshops with stakeholders to enhance organizational data literacy
Develop and implement comprehensive data validation and cleansing processes to maintain the highest data quality standards
Lead the continuous improvement and optimization of the BI infrastructure and reporting capabilities using advanced BI tools and platforms (such as Tableau, Power BI, SQL, and Databricks)
Mentor and develop junior analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional growth within the team



Your Profile


Master’s degree in Business, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or related field. A master’s degree is strongly preferred
5+ years of extensive experience in business intelligence, data analysis, and reporting
Proven track record of delivering strategic insights and high-quality reports in a fast-paced environment
Advanced proficiency in BI tools such as Tableau/PowerBI, SQL, and Google Sheets
Experience with data warehousing, ETL processes, and real-time data processing frameworks



Please note that we are looking for support in the Berlin office of our portfolio company. Eligibility to work within the EU is required as well.

Benefits And Perks


Fulfil a role with entrepreneurial freedom and take a pre-validated business model to the next level
Join an experienced founding team of serial and 2nd-time founders
Attractive base and bonus compensation program
Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts



Apply below and become a part of our success story!

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion

Project A is committed to diverse and equal opportunities hiring for all – applicants, candidates, and employees alike. We value humans – with all our glorious multifaceted backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences – and look forward to your application.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.




We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.




Responsibilities




Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.




Required Skills




5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
Previous experience with AB testing
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Desirable Skills




Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Show more

Required Skills


  • 5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
  • Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
  • Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
  • Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
  • Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
  • Previous experience with AB testing
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
  • Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
  • Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
  • Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
  • Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.


Desirable Skills


  • Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
  • Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
  • Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
  • An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Title: Senior People Data Analyst
Description:
We believe it takes great people to create a great product. That’s why our team lives our company values, and we hire based on them, too. Since 2010, Pipedrive has been on a mission to support sales and marketing teams with easy-to-use, powerful tools that make everyday work faster and easier. Today, our cloud-based software is trusted by over 100,000 companies and used in 179 countries. We have grown from a five-person team to a truly international company of over 850+ people, representing more than 50 nationalities, with ten offices distributed across Europe and the US. In 2020, Pipedrive received a majority investment from Vista Equity Partners, a global investment firm that invests exclusively in enterprise software, data and technology-enabled businesses, making Pipedrive the fifth unicorn from Estonia.

We are looking for a senior people data analyst to join our talented analytics team. In this role, you will leverage your expertise in data analysis and data visualisation to support and influence key business initiatives. Your insights will directly contribute to optimising our operations and will help guide strategic decisions across the organisation.

Your new adventure:


Gather and analyze data from various P&C systems and sources, including HRIS, ATS, performance management tools, employee surveys, and external benchmarks
Identify current industry trends and patterns within People data to provide insights into areas such as recruitment, talent management, workforce demographics, turnover rates, performance metrics, and employee engagement and proactively identify opportunities to enhance the organization’s analytical capabilities
Develop and maintain key People metrics and dashboards to track progress and identify areas for improvement. Present findings and recommendations through clear and compelling data visualizations and presentations
Provide data-driven recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders to inform strategic decisions related to human resources and organizational development
Collaborate with P&C business partners and other stakeholders to understand business needs and develop solutions that optimize the employee experience and drive organizational success
Lead or participate in special projects and initiatives related to HR analytics, such as predictive modelling, workforce planning, and diversity and inclusion initiatives
Mentor and provide guidance to junior members of the HR analytics team, fostering a culture of continuous learning and development
Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and ethical standards when handling sensitive HR data, maintaining confidentiality and data security at all times.


Does this sound like you?


4+ years of experience as an analyst with a focus on HR projects
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience working with data visualisation tools such as Tableau or Power BI
Ability to create and present data-driven stories to different stakeholders
Good understanding of SQL and Python is a plus


Why Pipedrive:


A value-driven work environment where people come first
A lively bunch of colleagues from over 50 different countries, with offices in Tallinn, Tartu, Lisbon, Prague, London, Dublin, New York, Florida, Riga and Berlin
A team serious about getting things done while not taking ourselves too seriously
A world-class working environment full of perks like parties, snacks, and drinks like Spezi and Club-Mate, and, of course, office dogs
Flexible working hours as long as you’re there for your team members
Freedom to execute your ideas with a passionate and motivated team supporting you
Lots of room for personal and career development, with internal and external training opportunities
Competitive salary and bonus system and all the benefits you’d expect from a great employer (health coverage, transportation allowance, language courses, in-house coaches, employee discounts, and more)


Pipedrive is an equal-opportunity employer. We encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of age, gender, race, religion, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity or veteran status.

We're on the looking for a senior people data analyst to join our team in Berlin.

If this is something for you, send us your resume (in English) or a link to your LinkedIn profile and please add why we should pay extra attention to your application.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
The Role

My client are seeking a talented Data Engineer to join their growing team. You will play a key role in designing, building, and maintaining our data pipelines and infrastructure. This role requires a strong understanding of PostgreSQL databases and experience working with cloud platforms.




Responsibilities

Design, develop, and implement data pipelines for ingesting, transforming, and loading data from various sources into our data warehouse.

Optimize PostgreSQL databases for performance and scalability.

Develop and maintain SQL queries for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Work with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) to provision and manage data storage, compute resources, and containerized applications.

Write code in scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) to automate data engineering tasks.

Collaborate with data analysts, data scientists, and software engineers to ensure data quality and accessibility.

Document data pipelines, schemas, and procedures.

Stay up-to-date on the latest data engineering and cloud technologies.




Qualifications

Strong expertise in PostgreSQL, including database design, administration, performance tuning, and security.

Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.

Experience with cloud platforms (AWS preferred) for data storage, compute resources, and services (e.g., S3, DynamoDB, Redshift, Aurora, Athena).

Experience with scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash).

Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

Strong communication and collaboration skills.

Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

Ability to manage complex projects and interact effectively with other teams.




Bonus Points

Interest in working on providing solutions to environmental sustainability.

Experience with database change management systems like Liquibase, Flyway etc

Experience with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark, Kafka).

Experience with data warehousing concepts (e.g., dimensional modelling, slowly changing dimensions etc).

Certifications in cloud platforms or data engineering tools (e.g., AWS Certified Data Engineer).

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Job Description: Data Engineer (m/f/d)

Join an innovative tech company that specializes in developing secure and cutting-edge software solutions. We are committed to providing secure cloud storage, collaborative tools, and advanced data management systems that empower organizations in education, the public sector, and modern work environments. We prioritize security and usability to deliver robust software solutions for our diverse client base.




Your Responsibilities:

Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines and ETL processes to ensure efficient data flow and integration.
Collaborate with data scientists, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and implement solutions that meet business needs.
Optimize and maintain existing databases and data storage solutions to enhance performance and ensure data security.
Develop and implement data governance and security measures to protect sensitive information in compliance with best practices and regulations.
Monitor and troubleshoot data systems to ensure high availability and reliability.
Participate in designing and building data architectures that support secure, efficient data management.
Work with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) to manage and deploy data solutions.




Job Requirements:

Completed
Professional experience in data engineering, data warehousing, or a similar role.
Strong experience with SQL and database management systems (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle).
Familiarity with ETL tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache NiFi, Talend, Airflow).
Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or Java for data manipulation and analysis.
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) is desirable.
Familiarity with cloud platforms and services (e.g., AWS Redshift, Azure Synapse, Google BigQuery).
Understanding of data security, privacy, and governance best practices.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.




What We Offer You:

Comprehensive onboarding with regular feedback to support your professional growth.
A collaborative corporate culture characterized by team spirit, curiosity, and mutual support.
Quick decision-making processes in a dynamic and creative work environment.




Additional Benefits:

Work-life balance: 30 days of vacation annually.
Meal support: Lunch vouchers to subsidize your meals.
Fitness perks: Subsidy for sports club memberships.
Learning & Development: Opportunities for personal growth, including internal book clubs and lecture series.
Team building: Regular company events such as Christmas parties and barbecues.
Location: A centrally located office in Berlin with excellent public transportation links.




If you are ready to take on a new challenge and help us build secure, innovative software solutions with a focus on data engineering, apply now to join our dynamic team in Berlin!

Title: Senior People Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders)
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Senior HR Data & Reporting Analyst (all genders) to join the People Analytics team on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

About the People Analytics team:


Data Infrastructure & Architecture: We design and maintain the data warehouse (AWS or BigQuery), integrating new systems to enhance our analytic capabilities while ensuring data privacy compliance.
Reporting and Visualization: Define and standardize People KPIs across local teams, and deliver automated reporting solutions via Tableau or other BI tools for effective data visualization.
Advanced Analytics & Data Science: Discover and communicate meaningful patterns in people data, using analytics and data science models to provide actionable insights.
Purpose and Mission: Enable senior leaders to make data-driven decisions, enhance employee experience, and improve business performance through comprehensive data analysis.
Long-term Goals: Aim for global reporting of key metrics with high accuracy, simplify complex HR and business challenges, and integrate data insights into daily decision-making.
Collaborative Approach: Work closely with local People Analytics teams to align metrics and reporting standards, ensuring a unified approach to data management.
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with People Analytics teams, CHROs, P&C leaders, People Partners, and Senior Leaders for strategic decision-making based on reliable data.
Value Addition: Harmonize data across global teams, creating a single source of truth for reliable and consistent leadership decisions.


About the role:


Data Warehouse Management: Design, build, and maintain the architecture and infrastructure of our data warehouse, ensuring system integration and data compliance.
KPI Standardization: Define and align People KPIs across local teams, and implement automated reporting solutions for streamlined data visualization and analysis.
Analytics and Insights: Use advanced analytics to uncover meaningful patterns in people data, and develop data science models that provide actionable insights.
Stakeholder Collaboration: Gather requirements from CHROs and other stakeholders, translate these into actionable plans, and serve as the primary contact for people data.
Global Reporting: Collaborate with local teams for global reporting of key metrics, ensuring a unified and reliable data source for strategic decisions.
Training and Adoption: Provide training and support to drive the adoption of new BI tools and reporting practices, enhancing overall data literacy and user experience.


What you need to be successful


Background working in similar People/HR data-driven role (3+ years of experience, a must)
Advanced SQL and knowledge about data pipelines
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or other technical fields
Proven, direct experience with Tableau and demonstrate storytelling capabilities
Data visualization artist, able to create new and engaging ways of visualizing People data


Nice to have:


Worked in cross functional teams and can manage senior stakeholders
Fundamental understanding of statistics and basic principles of data analysis


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, we enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
Look up and go for it. We will support you in developing yourself and your career: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Online Canteen, Corporate Discounts


At Delivery Hero, we believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring -- therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. Just be yourself and we can’t wait to see what value you bring to the role. We're as interested in your character as we are in your talent.

Title: Data Engineer (w/d/m)
Description:
Sind Sie auf der Suche nach neuen und spannenden Herausforderungen? Dann beginnen Sie Ihre Karriere bei uns und werden Sie Teil eines unserer Kundenprojekte.




IHRE TÄTIGKEITSSCHWERPUNKTE

Konzeption, Entwicklung und Wartung von Datenpipelines zur Erfassung, Verarbeitung und Speicherung umfangreicher Datenströme
Implementierung von skalierbaren Datenbanken, Data Warehouses und anderen Speicherlösungen
Optimierung der Dateninfrastruktur hinsichtlich Skalierbarkeit, Leistung und Zuverlässigkeit
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit Datenanalysten, Data Scientists und anderen Teammitgliedern, um Datenanforderungen zu verstehen und maßgeschneiderte Lösungen zu entwickeln
Gewährleistung der Einhaltung von Datenschutz- und Sicherheitsstandards in allen Phasen der Datenverarbeitung







WAS SIE DAFÜR MITBRINGEN

Abgeschlossenes Studium in Informatik, Datenwissenschaft, Ingenieurwissenschaften oder einem ähnlichen Fachbereich
Erfahrung in der Entwicklung von Datenpipelines und -infrastrukturen
Kenntnisse in Datenbanktechnologien wie SQL, NoSQL sowie in Big-Data-Frameworks wie z.B. Hadoop, Spark o.ä. sind ein Plus
Programmierkenntnisse in Python, Java oder Scala
Teamfähigkeit und die Fähigkeit, effektiv in einem agilen Umfeld zu arbeiten
Analytische Denkweise und ausgeprägte Problemlösungsfähigkeiten
Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse

*Mut zur Lücke! Auch wenn Sie nicht alle Anforderungen erfüllen: Trauen Sie sich und bewerben Sie sich bei uns!







WARUM SIE BEI UNS GENAU RICHTIG SIND

Es besteht die Möglichkeit zum Teil im Homeoffice zu arbeiten und somit von den Vorteilen hybrider Arbeit zu profitieren (flexibles Arbeiten)
Teamspirit und Diversität
Work-Life-Balance
Attraktive Vergütung
Sozialleistungen
Vielseitige Weiterbildungsmöglichkeiten
Team- und Sportevents
Globales Netzwerk
Attraktives Mitarbeiterempfehlungsprogramm




Die Benefits können je nach Position und Standort variieren. Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits befindet sich auf unserer Webseite unterhalb Karriere und Benefits.




Senden Sie uns direkt Ihre Bewerbung zu. Für Rückfragen stehen wir Ihnen gerne zur Verfügung. Wir freuen uns über die Bewerbung von Menschen, die zur Vielfalt unseres Unternehmens beitragen.
