Title: Data Analyst – Digital & Creative Agencies
Description:
Fantastic opportunities available for impressive and award winning global agencies working with a breadth of well-known and household brands.




Our clients are a mix of creative, digital, & media agencies who are looking for data talent to transform raw data into actionable insights and aid business critical decision making.




Hybrid working- circa 3 days a week in a London office
Negotiable salary depending on level of experience




The role:




Link data and tech with creativity to provide statistics and data driven insights to their clients marketing & business challenges
Partner with the internal data teams (Data visualisation, Data science) to ensure you work together to solve all client data driven challenges
Develop and maintain data systems, preparing detailed reports, and presenting findings to stakeholders
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators.
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies, providing insights that drive business decisions and enhance client campaigns.
Continuously seeking ways to improve data collection and analysis processes
Drive measurable results
- Staying updated with the latest industry trends and technologies to implement best practices.




The person:




Inquisitive with an analytical mindset
Ambitious and career driven
Previous experience working in a marketing or creative agency
Experience using data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, or R, along with experience in data visualisation software like Tableau or Power BI.
A solid understanding of statistical methods and data modelling techniques
Experience in customer journey analysis and planning
Ideally a degree in a relevant field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science, or Economics
Attention to detail, a high level of accuracy, and the ability to work under pressure




We are committed to ensuring and supporting representation from all backgrounds across the creative industry, irrespective of race, religion, belief, ethnicity, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability or socio-economic background.

With this in mind, we welcome applications from all areas of the community. Please do get in touch and let us know if there is any additional support or reasonable adjustments we can cater for, to ensure our process and roles fit your needs and creates a comfortable & enjoyable recruitment process.

Title: Football Data Analyst
Description:
Football Data Analyst (one day a week in the central London office)

​

This role is a unique opportunity to combine technical challenges with creativity in a collaborative, high-standard work environment. By joining this team, you’ll not only be part of a creative and open work culture focused on innovation and excellence but also have the chance to work with and collaborate with some of the most well-known footballers in the industry.




This position offers significant opportunities for professional growth within sports analytics and the potential to impact sports performance through advanced technology, making it an ideal setting for those passionate about leveraging cutting-edge technology to make meaningful contributions in the world of sports analytics.




Ideal for those eager to blend their passion for sports with cutting-edge technology, aiming to make significant contributions in sports analytics. If you’re a detail-oriented innovator and team player, we’re excited to hear from you.




Responsibilities for the role of Football Data Analyst will include:




Collect, clean, and process football-related data from various sources.
Develop and implement statistical models and algorithms to analyze player performance and match outcomes.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with football analysts, coaches, and other stakeholders to understand their needs and provide actionable insights.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in sports analytics and data science.




As the selected Football Data Analyst, you background should include:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Essential - Proven experience in data science within the sports industry.
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Knowledge of football tactics, strategies, and player performance metrics.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.




Please note: even if you don't have exactly the background indicated, do contact us now if this type of job is of interest - we may well have similar opportunities that you would be suited to. And of course, we always get your permission before submitting your CV to a company.

Title: Data Analyst (SQL / Python) - Global Media Tech
Description:
The role: Data Analyst (SQL, Python, Tableau)

Business: Global Media Tech

Contract: 6 months - with a strong possibility of extension (to start ASAP - max 4 weeks’ notice)

Salary: £70k to £90k basic - DOE (PAYE, paid weekly, within IR35)

Location: Hybrid based out of Central London offices (min 3 days per week)




You must be fully clear to work in the UK without the need of relocation/visa sponsorship




A leading BigTech client in Central London is looking to hire an experienced Data Analyst. This role is to drive business value by supporting the EMEA / Global Partnerships team with data collection, cleaning, analysis, and visualisation and to collaborate on product analytics, market analysis, and operational efficiency projects.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse large datasets using various tools
Identify trends and communicate findings
Collaborate with teams for data-driven solutions
Improve data quality and efficiency




Requirements:

A minimum of 4+ years in data analysis, ideally within the tech SaaS arena
Strong, proven skills with SQL, Python and Tableau
Strong communication skills
Any experience within the BigTech market is ideal, but not essential




The next step:

Apply today with CV or LinkedIn profile for immediate review. All communications will be treated in the strictest of confidence by Dan at Principle.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Enna is a specialised recruitment agency for neurodivergent job seekers - we support candidates who identify as neurodivergent - autistic, ADHD, dyslexia, dyspraxia etc.

About The Role

OmniGov’s Communication’s Intelligence team are searching for a Data Analyst to join the team and help provide best in class data analysis and marketing effectiveness solutions for Omnigov, private sector clients and media agencies within OMG. Uniquely in OmniGOV, the strategic analytics team within the wider communications intelligence group runs consultancy and MMM projects with commercial clients, as well as delivering cross-government campaign analysis to OmniGOV and HM Government.

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in our ongoing quest for understanding and insights. You’ll contribute to building and maintaining our essential Government benchmark database and knowledge system. Your responsibilities will include sophisticated data analysis, methodology evolution, and generating reports for key categories and brands. Additionally, you’ll create visualisations and automate processes related to Government files and databases.

The role is varied, interesting and provides excellent opportunities to work with a wide range of people, techniques and solutions, within OmniGOV and the wider agency group.

The Communications Intelligence team are a team of 16 people based in Omnicom’s impressive offices in Bankside. We are passionate about data, all types of analysis but especially strategic analysis and leading the provision of marketing effectiveness solutions for all our stakeholders.

Role Requirements

Government Benchmark Database Maintenance:


Collaborate with a Manager to add new data to the Government benchmark databases managed by Omnigov and the Benchmarking team.
Quality checks and data loading using tools like R, Python, and Power BI.


Support the wider Communications Intelligence Team


Support and mentor Junior Analysts to ensure high-quality work and a commitment to growth and development.
Engage in the wider Communications Intelligence Strategic goals to drive higher quality work for our clients.
Feed into our wider vision and strategy as a team


Agency Relationships


Support and coach Junior Data Analysts
Cultivate day-to-day relationships with users of the knowledge system within agencies and OmniGOV’s Government databases
Provide excellent service levels to agencies working with analysts and managers


Client Relationships


Support the team in consultancy engagements with Government clients
Update and build comprehensive datasets for agency pitch analysis from the knowledge database content
Deliver high-quality visualisations and effectively communicate data insights to agency clients
Use advanced analytical approaches to analyse data to establish norms and averages, interpreting findings


Skills Required


Experience in a Marketing Analytics role (MMM or similar)
Understanding of the role of media
Experience in developing analytic models
Coding proficiency (R or Python preference)
Expertise in Excel
Interested in Government marketing and media
Strong attention to detail
Good written and communication skills
Highly organised & Strong critical thinking
Willingness to Learn, energetic, determined, proactive and curious


Nice To Haves


English and maths GCSEs at grade C (4) or above or equivalents.
Degree in an analytical subject 2:1 Or higher


About The Agency

OmniGov is a specialist division created to handle UK Government media buying, the largest advertiser in the UK, and a top 10 UK agency in its own right, handling over 80 very different government departments. We were originally awarded the four year contract in 2018 and late 2021 we became the first agency ever to retain the business for the next 4 years.

Our ambition is to be the best Government Media Buying service in the world, intelligently using media to deliver public services. In doing so we want to lead the industry in the UK and be one of the best places to work and learn in the media sector. In fact, we have been Campaign’s Agency Team of the Year for the last 3 years.

Our team of c.150 people are passionate about delivering better outcomes for the public sector. Why? This is taxpayers’ money we are dealing with, and the outcomes of these campaigns really do matter. Effectiveness is the driving factor. You will work on campaigns that can represent the most profoundly challenging issues in our society aiming to help, improve or save lives. At other times they simply aim to inform the public. But at all times they matter. To people across the UK and beyond, to us, our families and our own communities.

We are organised across different client hubs themed by government priority nationally, regionally and internationally.

Our core teams and expertise encompass Account Management, Effectiveness & Evaluation, Implementation Planning and Media Activation across all channels. We also have specialist services such as Strategic partnerships, Innovation, Behavioural Planning, Communications Intelligence including Data Engineering, Reporting/Visualisation, Data Science, Strategic Analytics, Brand Safety and Data Ethics.

OmniGOV draws from the best of Omnicom Group UK and sits as a unit within MG OMD, Campaigns Media Agency of the year 2021 and 2024, the largest agency within OMG UK and the most awarded media agency ever for IPA Effectiveness.

Working for OmniGOV is different to other jobs in the media agency sector. Working with government can be challenging, dynamic and demands the highest standards, but above all it is important work and rewarding. We believe there is no better place to learn and grow in the industry.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Skill Farm Experts Are Invited to Apply for the Following Role:

Responsibilities:

Provide state of the art operational data expertise to support investment teams and build strong connections with business stakeholders.

Secure daily data production tasks; delivering work of high quality. Daily tasks are structured into 3 groups forming the rota and you will be exposed to all shifts over time. Responsibilities include loading datasets, verifying overnight batches, checking the quality of accruals etc. These are designed to ensure data quality and consistency across systems.

Manage instruments and portfolios data exceptions to secure core investment data (securities statics, classifiers, pricing, analytics, valuations and P&L) as part of the day to day production:

Set up securities accurately and quickly as per the fund manager or traders' request so orders can be placed for trading; manage any exceptions when required.

Resolve issues/exceptions in a timely manner and escalate to management as required.

Actively provide updates to other team members, as well as internal stakeholders.

Perform daily data quality checks on Securities.

Continually improve and develop procedures/processes as the business advances by presenting findings and recommendations to the team.

Participate in the implementation of data management processes and the rollout of our Enterprise Data Management (EDM) solution within an agile framework.

Active involvement in Data and transversal Operations projects. Engage with stakeholders to understand and frame business issues, investigate and communicate findings and solutions to management.

Pro-actively collaborate with the Data team based in Singapore and manage the daily handover.

Skills:

Undergraduate degree in either Finance or Sciences.

Minimum 2-3 years' experience in a similar role within asset management, investment banking or financial vendors.

Strong knowledge of securities static data. An understanding of pricing, analytics and portfolio valuation is beneficial (ETD, OTC, Alternative Assets).

Good knowledge of investment operations systems and data providers, i.e. Bloomberg, Markit, Simcorp, Charles River, NeoXam. Knowledge of JIRA and Tableau beneficial.

Good communication skills, culture of service excellence, and a solution-oriented team player, you will be comfortable adapting to a shift/rota pattern.

Ability to establish and develop effective business engagement relationships with transversal stakeholders.

You will be self-motivated, curious, and detail-oriented. You will have a proactive approach to problem solving as well as being disciplined, rigorous and forward thinking with a flexible attitude and business-oriented sense of priorities.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity

We are currently looking for a Client Data Associate to join ACA Mirabella’s Data and Implementations Team. This person will assist the day-to-day clients’ data onboarding, supporting the client implementation team with data quality issues and helping to identify data inconsistencies.

We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Client Data Associate to join our dynamic team. The ideal candidate must be a team player and be able to collaborate effectively with other stakeholders to support data management and implementation. Self initiative to learn in a challenging, fast-paced and developing regulatory environment is an asset.

The position requires strong analytical skills, and a passion for data integrity and quality. Core responsibilities involve the seamless integration and management of client data obtained from various external systems into our internal control framework.

What you’ll do:



Assist in the day-to-day clients’ data onboarding process, including ongoing collaboration with departments and updating internal documentation (FAQs, Data Samples, Data Specs, etc)
Assist in recognising potential data inconsistencies and reconcile appropriately to preserve data integrity.
Assist identifying data quality issues through analysis and work with departments to resolve them.
Assist client implementation team with data mapping and help resolve any data inconsistency issues detected.
Work closely with internal teams to address data quality issues and enhance data workflows.
Ensure timely and accurate response to internal and external data requests. Maintain detailed documentation of data onboarding processes, client data specifications, and data mappings.
Performs any other related duties as required or assigned.


Knowledge and Skills Required:



Bachelor's degree in Finance, Mathematics, Statistics, Computer or Data Science, or a related field.
1-2 years of relevant work experience, working with large data sets preferably in the financial services sector.
Proficiency in Excel – pivot tables, lookups, etc.
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to work with personnel at all levels.
Able to work independently and be resourceful, with excellent time management skills.
Able to work independently and be resourceful, with excellent time management skills.


Desirable skills/experience:



Data analytics.
Disclosure reporting.
Surveillance systems implementation.
Power BI/Tableau.
SQL/Python .


What working at ACA offers:

We offer a competitive compensation package where you’ll be rewarded based on your performance and recognized for the value you bring to our business. Our Total Rewards package includes medical and dental coverage and 401(k) plans, and a wide range of paid time off options as well as a flexible work environment. You’ll also be granted time off for designated ACA Paid Holidays, Summer Fridays, Personal/Family Care, and other leaves of absence when needed to support your physical, financial, and emotional well-being. We also offer unique benefits such as Student Debt Forgiveness and Pet Insurance.

About Mirabella:

Established in 2004, ACA Mirabella provides regulated financial services to the discretionary management and advisory sectors and manages approximately $30bn in assets.

ACA Mirabella, part of the ACA Group, offers a high-quality and flexible regulatory hosting platform in the UK and continental Europe (via Malta). ACA Mirabella has helped over two hundred firms undertake regulated activities under its umbrella, while allowing them to retain their own brand identity and control.

About ACA:

ACA Group is the leading governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) advisor in financial services. We empower our clients to reimagine GRC and protect and grow their business. Our innovative approach integrates consulting, managed services, and our ComplianceAlpha® technology platform with the specialized expertise of former regulators and practitioners and our deep understanding of the global regulatory landscape.

What we commit to:

ACA is firmly committed to a policy of non-discrimination, which applies to recruiting, hiring, placement, promotions, training, discipline, terminations, layoffs, transfers, leaves of absence, compensation and all other terms and conditions of employment. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or protected veteran status, or any other legally protected basis, in accordance with applicable law.

Title: Football Data Analyst
Description:
Football Data Analyst (one day a week in the central London office)

​

This role is a unique opportunity to combine technical challenges with creativity in a collaborative, high-standard work environment. By joining this team, you’ll not only be part of a creative and open work culture focused on innovation and excellence but also have the chance to work with and collaborate with some of the most well-known footballers in the industry.




This position offers significant opportunities for professional growth within sports analytics and the potential to impact sports performance through advanced technology, making it an ideal setting for those passionate about leveraging cutting-edge technology to make meaningful contributions in the world of sports analytics.




Ideal for those eager to blend their passion for sports with cutting-edge technology, aiming to make significant contributions in sports analytics. If you’re a detail-oriented innovator and team player, we’re excited to hear from you.




Responsibilities for the role of Football Data Analyst will include:




Collect, clean, and process football-related data from various sources.
Develop and implement statistical models and algorithms to analyze player performance and match outcomes.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Collaborate with football analysts, coaches, and other stakeholders to understand their needs and provide actionable insights.
Stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in sports analytics and data science.




As the selected Football Data Analyst, you background should include:




Bachelor's or Master's degree in Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Essential - Proven experience in data science within the sports industry.
Strong programming skills in Python and SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Knowledge of football tactics, strategies, and player performance metrics.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills with the ability to explain complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.




Please note: even if you don't have exactly the background indicated, do contact us now if this type of job is of interest - we may well have similar opportunities that you would be suited to. And of course, we always get your permission before submitting your CV to a company.

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
We are keen to speak with junior data analysts about joining an investment management client of ours, based in Central London. This will be on a 12-month contract with an expectation to be extended or taken on permanently upon completion.

This is a hybrid position with 3 days in the office.

This role offers a unique opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to grow within a dynamic and challenging environment. You'll be working on a high-profile client project, gaining hands-on experience with large datasets and contributing to data-driven strategies.

You Will Be Responsible For


Managing and processing large datasets, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
Developing and maintaining dashboards to support data visualisation and decision-making.
Analysing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business strategies.
Collaborating with stakeholders and clients to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.


Requirements


University Graduates with 0-2 years of experience
A keen interest to work in Investment Management
Keen to identify and embrace new technologies and new ways of working
Experience in Power BI and SQL (Desirable)
Effective prioritisation and organisational skills
Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
Good IT skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook


Benefits


£30,000 for graduates with less than 1 year of experience, up to £50,000 for graduates with 2+ years of experience.

HTML:
We are keen to speak with junior data analysts about joining an investment management client of ours, based in Central London. This will be on a 12-month contract with an expectation to be extended or taken on permanently upon completion.

This is a hybrid position with 3 days in the office.

This role offers a unique opportunity for a Junior Data Analyst to grow within a dynamic and challenging environment. You'll be working on a high-profile client project, gaining hands-on experience with large datasets and contributing to data-driven strategies.

You Will Be Responsible For

  • Managing and processing large datasets, ensuring accuracy and efficiency.
  • Developing and maintaining dashboards to support data visualisation and decision-making.
  • Analysing data to identify trends, patterns, and insights that drive business strategies.
  • Collaborating with stakeholders and clients to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights.

Requirements

  • University Graduates with 0-2 years of experience
  • A keen interest to work in Investment Management
  • Keen to identify and embrace new technologies and new ways of working
  • Experience in Power BI and SQL (Desirable)
  • Effective prioritisation and organisational skills
  • Excellent communication skills, both written and oral
  • Good IT skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and Outlook

Benefits

  • £30,000 for graduates with less than 1 year of experience, up to £50,000 for graduates with 2+ years of experience.

Title: Data Analyst - Alteryx + 10% bonus
Description:
#Salary on this role is tax free#




Overview

Our client is an established, international bank that is involved in progressive policy reform and investment, across multiple continents. They have over 4000 employees globally and are now looking for an experienced Data Analyst to join their team on a 3-year FTC basis, providing support internally on Alteryx and solution design for businesses.




Main Responsibilities

◾ Provide support in the use and development of solutions using Alteryx and Tableau internally.

◾ Advocate a consistent analysis, design, development and delivery of data solutions using recognized processes and techniques.

◾ Educate end-users in data solutions by proactively engaging with product owners, internal and external stakeholders.

◾ Create documents and workshops to educate users on data solutions.

◾ Document requests, test plans and solution designs.




Skills and Experience

◾ Extensive experience of development in Alteryx and Tableau.

◾ Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role

◾ Experience in the creation of dataflows, extracts, views, workbooks, deployments, schedules.

◾ Working knowledge of SQL (Oracle/SQL Server), data modelling concepts and standards.

◾ Familiarity with ETL processes and data warehousing principles.

◾ Strong team player with ability to work in a cross-functional team, following Agile principles.

◾ Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills.

◾ Experience in organising workshops and trainings is desirable.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.
Show more

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

Title: Social Data Analyst
Description:
Social Data Analyst role at a fast-growing independent performance / paid social agency.







Salary to £38,000 + bonus. Based Central London (2 days required in office per week).







Summary

This role has huge growth potential – potentially to grow the team and manage a small department in years to come
Across a range of clients with a big B2C brand focus
You will ideally have experience with Looker (or similar) and be super-interested in social analytics and presenting data in clear, translatable ways for clients
Focus is paid social but also keen to expand on organic social analytics







As a Data Analyst, you'll contribute to the agencies growth by diving deep into data from platforms like Google, Meta, and TikTok to unearth insights that shape our campaigns.







The business has ambitious growth targets and are looking to organically grow to double in size by 2026. They have an inclusive working environment where team togetherness is promoted, including team lunches and Thursday night social’s.







Key Responsibilities:




Data Integration - Integrate data from multiple sources using Funnel, ensuring accuracy and accessibility for analysis.
Report Creation - Create and maintain Looker Studio reports for daily decision-making, continuously improving their accuracy and usefulness.
Experimentation - Run structured experiments, identify testing opportunities, implement them, manage rewards, and communicate results.
Data Analysis - Conduct incrementality studies, analyze trends using spreadsheets and Python notebooks, and provide detailed insights.
Tracking - Audit tracking setups, build tracking maps, and help clients troubleshoot tracking issues.







What We Need from You:




3+ years’ experience within a social / data analyst role
Proficiency in using spreadsheets for daily tasks.
Strong data analysis skills to surface insights and present them clearly.
Excellent communication skills for presenting findings.
B2C client experience
Attention to detail to ensure accuracy and reliability in data handling.
Knowledge of marketing data and its complexities.
Experience with SQL, JavaScript, or Python is highly desirable.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, Meta Pixel, Google Analytics, and paid media management tools.
Experience running A/B tests and reporting findings.
Interest in AI trends and technologies for measuring metrics in social media.

Title: Data Analyst Trainee
Description:
Are you looking to benefit from a new career in Data Analysis?

If you are detail orientated, perceptive, organised, competent, analytical and can communicate well with those around you; you could have a truly rewarding future as a Data Analyst

We do this using our specialised Data Analyst career programme which looks to assist and place qualified candidates into a career pathway in Data Analysis.

Please note this career program is designed for entry level individuals with limited or no experience, so please do not apply if you are already an experience Data Analyst as we will be looking primarily at entry level roles.

Demand for Data Analysts has grown 20% year on year with experienced analysts easily commanding salaries of £50k+. All business decisions rely on data to ensure correct business decisions are made and therefore the role of the data analyst in the new digital world has become essential for business owners.

Below are current average salaries in the sector for lower-level positions and fully trained Data Analysts:


Junior Data Analyst - £30,000
Data Analyst - £50,000
Business Data Analyst - £67,500
Data Analytics Analyst - £80,000
Business Analysts - £60,000


Using our experience in providing data analysis and business analysis training online and through our expert recruitment consultants, we can provide a seamless journey and often fast-tracked route into a new career in Data Analysis.

The courses in the package have been identified by our recruitment partners as industry standards for the UK/European and International Data Analysis sector.

Skills shortages across all sectors are increasing the demand for qualified, entry-level career seekers and career changers.

Whether you are working full-time, part-time or are unemployed, this job and recruitment package has the flexibility to be completed at a pace that suits you and can be completed in a few weeks. Your job and career goals are completed in 4 easy steps listed below.

Step 1 - CompTIA Data+ Qualification

The first step is completing the CompTIA Data+ Qualification accredited by CompTIA.

This professional international industry-recognised qualification teaches you the essential skills of a Data Analyst. You will cover skills such as data mining, manipulating data, visualising data, and reporting on data.

Study time for the qualification is approximately 30 hours and qualification is achieved by completing a 1-hour multiple choice exam.

The course is provided online and comes complete with exam simulators and revision tools.

You will be provided with access to a tutor and a 1-hour online revision workshop prior to sitting your exam.

This qualification will set you on a route to becoming a data analyst.

Step 2 - Data Administration Training

Data is extracted using various method which are normally IT driven.

Therefore, we will provide you with access to the following additional courses to ensure you are suitably employable as a data analyst.


Microsoft excel - to expert level.
Learn SQL - the programming language used for extracting data from more complex databases.
Learn Python 3 - Python 3 is a simple to use programming language used by many analysts.
Learn Tableau - Tableu is a tool which analysts use to build visually appealing dashboards for complex data making it easier for stakeholders to comprehend.


Study time for these courses is approximately 30-60 hours and qualification is achieved through completion of the course with no exam.

Step 3 - Business Analysis Foundation

Business Analysts and Data Analysts often work very closely together and indeed many Data Analysts become Business Analysts and vice versa.

Adding a Business Analyst Foundation certificate will make you much more employable and enable you to cross over into business analyst roles and hybrid roles. Business Analysis Foundation accredited by the BCS (The British Computer Society also known as the Chartered Institute of IT).

Study time for this course is approximately 15 hours and qualification is achieved through an online BCS exam.

Step 4 - Recruitment Support

Now you are qualified for an entry level data analyst position our recruitment support team will now begin collaborating with you to help you secure your first a suitable role based on your new qualifications and any other experience you may have.

We have been helping candidates start and build careers in the project management industry since 2007 and have a 4.8 Trustscore on Trustpilot.

Our Recruitment Support team will help you work through job applications, interviews and provide you with a full cv review based around your new qualification and written to maximise your chances of obtaining a role in the project management sector.

They will provide you with guidance as to which roles our most suitable for you as an entry level project sector worker aiming to become a project manager. This will include mock job interviews as well as any help you feel you need.

Our money back guarantee

If after 1 year of passing your formal qualifications, we have been unable to help you secure a role, we will refund your study fees minus the cost of the exams.

However, we are normally able to help candidates find their first role within 6 months of qualifying and for locations based close to major cities this is often reduced to less than 3 months.

Check our testimonials from the hundreds of candidates we have already helped.

What Now?

To accommodate candidates, the training element of the package is available on finance terms of up to 1 year. This enables you to get qualified and start in your new role without having to fund all the training costs up front.

Enquire now and one of our experienced Career Consultants will contact you within 4 working hours to answer any questions that you may have and to assist you in taking the first step towards your Data Analyst Career aspirations.

Title: Data Analyst - Risk
Description:
We are seeking a proactive and detail-oriented Data Analyst to join our clients Risk Models and Data team within the 2nd Line of Defence (2LOD). This is an exciting opportunity to support key data analysis and governance initiatives while contributing to the wider risk management function.




Key Responsibilities:

Run regular production of Management Information (MI) reports and handle ad-hoc data analysis requests.
Assist in the development of both ad-hoc and regular management reporting through robust data analysis.
Enhance the efficiency of MI production processes.
Support data quality resolution and data lineage activities within the team.
Contribute to building a strong data governance and data quality framework within the risk function.
Ensure compliance with the bank's Risk Management framework and escalate concerns when necessary.




What We’re Looking For:

Minimum 1 year of experience working with data analysis in financial services.
Degree educated (or equivalent), preferably in a STEM subject.
Intermediate knowledge of SAS and SQL, with a passion for further development.
Understanding of risk/financial terminology with a desire to expand this knowledge.
Proficient in MS Excel, including formulas and pivot tables; knowledge of Power BI is a plus.
Strong attention to detail and a proactive, collaborative approach.




**unfortunately, no sponsorship is available for this position**

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst – Pensions - £465 Per Day (Inside IR35) – 6 Month Contract – Hybrid




Overview:

An excellent opportunity has become available with our client, a global financial services firm who are currently undergoing an exciting transformation. We are seeking a talented Data Analyst to offer expertise in data services (including data, interfaces, and report analysis) and to support both client implementations and the day-to-day operations of systems for internal and external clients.




The ideal candidate must have a minimum of 2 years of experience in administering or programming pension calculations.




Role & Responsibilities:

Contribute to the improvement and standardisation of processes, tools, and documentation for all deliverables related to "Data."
Actively share knowledge to reduce key main risks across Implementations and wider teams to enable self-service with their pension administration product.
Collaborate with the core product and development teams to identify and help with delivering cross-departmental improvements for pension administrations products.
Collaborate with your team leader to ensure that all implementation services meet the required quality standards and are delivered on time and within budget.
Understand, analyse, and document business requirements; develop working processes based on these requirements, considering existing and potential new systems.
Analyse, document, and adhere to Business Requirement Specifications standards.
Stay informed about changes in pension legislation that could impact the functionality of our products, systems, processes, and procedures.
Identify and recommend areas for improvement in existing systems, processes, and procedures to enhance efficiency and productivity.
Detect problems or shortcomings in documentation, propose, and implement solutions.
Accurately track working hours using Jira and the Time Recording Engine.
Assist business users throughout their User Acceptance Testing (UAT) cycle.
Actively participate in team and departmental meetings, as well as technical forums.




Essential Skills & Requirements:

At least 2 years of experience in administering or programming pension calculations.
Strong analytical skills and the ability to work effectively within set frameworks and deadlines.
Must be highly numerate, methodical, and logical, with excellent problem-solving abilities and a keen eye for detail.
A strong commitment to and enthusiasm for delivering high-quality work within established guidelines.
Solid technical knowledge of pensions and relevant legislation.
Experience with pensions administration software.
Proactively keeps up-to-date with developments and trends in the programming community.




Contract Details:

Day rate: £425 - £465 per day
IR35 status: Inside IR35 via Umbrella
Contract length: 6 months
Location: Hybrid / London (other locations across the UK available also) (2X per week)

  • A strong commitment to and enthusiasm for delivering high-quality work within established guidelines.
  • Solid technical knowledge of pensions and relevant legislation.
  • Experience with pensions administration software.
  • Proactively keeps up-to-date with developments and trends in the programming community.


Contract Details:

  • Day rate: £425 - £465 per day
  • IR35 status: Inside IR35 via Umbrella
  • Contract length: 6 months
  • Location: Hybrid / London (other locations across the UK available also) (2X per week)

Title: Data Analyst - Commodity Trading - £250k
Company: Paragon Alpha - Hedge Fund Talent Business
Description:
I'm collaborating with one of the worlds most successful multi-strat funds, who have synergized data and trading to maximize their returns. Symptomatically of this, they're looking for a Data Analyst to join a commodity team.




The firm have a huge data organization underpinning the trading lifecycle, and they place data analytics and data science teams embedded in the front office to enabled more data driven trades and investments.




The role entails wrangling data-sets with Python and SQL, and integrating various and disparate data-sets into trading strategies for PM teams.




Stack: Python, SQL, Bloomberg, AWS




The client are looking to speak to varied Data Analysts from a commodity background, with someone technically astute with Python and SQL as well as multiple asset classes.




If you would like the chance to earn a market leading salary with the opportunity to work in a hybrid model in tandem; then please do apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a tech savvy professional looking for your next role? This is an exciting opportunity to join a company within a dynamic team and make an impact within the company. This is a temporary - permanent opportunity.




Join our client as a Data Analyst, where you will play a critical role in driving performance, data management, and reporting within a fast-paced and reactive Facilities Management environment.

Key Responsibilities:

Conduct weekly performance reviews and collaborate with Operational Heads to ensure key metrics, dates, and targets are met using the CAFM system.
Build strong relationships with Operational, Projects, and Technical Service teams to ensure contract quality and performance are upheld.
Carry out mitigation reviews, supporting operational teams to ensure the correct actions are taken.
Write and manage both internal and external reports, ensuring all data is accurate, complete, and timely.
Use your knowledge of contract and service requirements to identify areas for improvement, utilising KPIs.
Manage data reports in Maximo or other CAFM systems and assist with the planning and monitoring of digital tool development projects.
Support the performance team by creating, uploading, and automating regular reports on electronic management systems.
Maintain digital filing systems (e.g., SharePoint).
Coordinate and support the delivery of training workshops to operational teams.
Assist with performance analysis and auditing work order data to drive improvements.
Support the organisation and development of new projects, such as Maximo reporting upgrades using Power BI tools.
Prepare and template regular report sets, such as daily operational analyses and monthly/quarterly contract reports.
Coordinate and manage the administration process for large meetings and workshops.
Provide ad-hoc administrative support to the team.

What We’re Looking For:

Experience in a Facilities Management environment.
Proficient user of Maximo or similar CAFM systems.
Strong administrative skills, with experience working in a reactive, fast-paced setting.
Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint) and Power BI.
A proactive, detail-oriented, and self-motivated team player.

Security Clearance:

Candidates must be able to pass SC security clearance.

Title: Data Analyst London (Entry Level)
Description:
Are you looking to kickstart your career in data?

Join iO-Sphere's unique training programme - the Data Analyst Experience Accelerator - it is designed to secure individuals their next career step and become a data analyst.

Apply now to join our upcoming cohorts starting on October 7th or November 18th: https://io-sphere.io/data-analytics

How does it work?


We work with our network of employers to understand their data talent needs. They are often looking for data analysts, senior analysts, data scientists, analytics engineers and effective managers
We recruit and train talented individuals over the course of 10 weeks to get them ready for the jobs with our employers
We match and connect our best students with our employers
Joining iO-Sphere means becoming part of the community for life. We continue to support our community with ongoing mentoring and training throughout their career


Ready to apply? It only takes a minute: https://io-sphere.io/data-analytics

The Roles

We work with many different organisations seeking to hire talented data analysts. The majority of these roles will require you to:


Identify, analyse, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets using technical tools like Excel, SQL, Power BI, Big Query and Python
Create dashboards, presentations, and recommendations to help solve complex business problems
Work with management to prioritise business and information needs
Generate strong insights about the business to be able to improve performance


Ideal Candidates


Highly numerate & analytical thinker
Curious problem solver
Humble and willing to learn
The ability to commit to full time for 10 weeks
Fluent in written and spoken English


What To Expect On The Experience Accelerator


The Experience Accelerator is a flexible 10-week programme to give talented data professionals the technical skills and experience to take their career to the next level. By the end, you will be an effective data analyst with the toolkit to land the job you want
The first 5 weeks are full-time and fully remote
The final 5 weeks are full-time and in-person


Ready to apply?

Step 1: Complete the 1-minute application form: https://io-sphere.io/data-analytics

Step 2: Proceed with the remaining steps of the application process

Step 3: Commence your journey with us on August 27th or October 7th, 2024!

We strongly encourage applications from women, people of colour, lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, and non-binary individuals, veterans, parents, and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to equal opportunities and welcome individuals from all backgrounds to participate in our program. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage of the application or interview process, please inform us.

Why choose iO-Sphere?

We run a unique training programme - the Data Analyst Experience Accelerator - that is designed to secure individuals their next career step and become a data analyst. Instead of a traditional classroom, you’ll be part of the new data team at our fictional e-commerce company, "Prism." From day one, you'll build the experience that leading employers require while learning the technical (Excel, SQL, Power BI, Python), professional, and business skills that are needed for a career in data. You will be delivering real projects using our data warehouse, which has over 500+ million rows of real data. We work with leading organisations looking to hire data analysts and match them with the best talent we have in our programs. We recruit our best students on behalf of our partner employers and use our training programmes to identify and up-skill people for their roles.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies—from the world’s largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups—use Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone’s reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe’s most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We’re looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$128,700 - C$174,100. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role’s On Target Earnings (“OTE”) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate’s experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant’s location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Key Responsibilities:

Decision Support: Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to support strategic business decisions.

Scenario Analysis: Conduct scenario analyses to evaluate potential outcomes of different business strategies.

Risk Assessment: Identify and assess risks associated with various business decisions and propose mitigation strategies.

Data Interpretation: Translate complex data into understandable and actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.

Collaboration: Work closely with business leaders to understand their objectives and provide analytical support.

Continuous Improvement: Identify opportunities for process improvements and implement best practices in decision analysis.

Data Visualization: Create and maintain dashboards and reports using Tableau or Power BI to visualize data trends and insights effectively.

Data Management: Utilize SQL to extract, manipulate, and manage data from various databases, ensuring data accuracy and integrity.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Business, Economics, Statistics, or a related field. A master’s degree or MBA is preferred.
3+ years of experience in decision analysis, business analysis, or a related field. Strong analytical skills and experience with statistical analysis tools.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or Power BI.
Ability to interpret complex data and present findings clearly and concisely. Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WHO IS RATEHUB?

We’re a company on a mission - We are a unique Canadian Fintech that is the one stop shop for all financial needs of the consumer - Save, Spend, Borrow, Invest, and Protect. Every single team member, from product & engineering to sales & marketing, finance, operations, and everything in between is obsessed with one thing; helping Canadians make better financial choices. And we’re pretty great at it, too. Via our digital application technology and our award-winning in-house brokerages, we help over 2M Canadians per month make a positive impact on their finances. We have many unique businesses - a mortgage brokerage, a life insurance brokerage, a home and auto insurance brokerage, a mortgage originations and servicing business, a Financial Services Marketplace and a content business across Ratehub and MoneySense. 365 days a year we deliver our users the best online mortgage experience, personalized Credit Card and Loans options, and cheaper auto & home insurance policies than they typically get from their existing financial adviser.

Changing how people make financial choices isn’t easy, though. We know that achieving our mission is full of challenges; challenges that can be complex and often unexpected, but that are always interesting, rewarding, and fun to solve as a team. This is where you come in. We are on the hunt for the right kind of people to join us and help lead us forward to continued growth.

We have a newly created Data Team that is capturing data, analyzing it, harvesting it, modeling it to provide meaningful insights to our Members and to our businesses. We’re looking for a top performing Data Analyst to join this team, which will be the backbone of all the businesses (based in downtown Toronto but also open to remote candidates)! Reporting to the Head of Data, the Data Analyst is a critical member of Ratehub’s team who will drive decision making across the company. You will work on high impact projects with business stakeholders and will need to use data to solve long-term and immediate business problems. The role will involve data analysis, modeling and insights development. The ideal candidate has strong communications skills, a passion for data, a background in quantitative analysis and an interest in personal finance. You will get the opportunity to work closely with the other analysts in the team as well as the business stakeholders to learn different parts of the business and provide valuable support with data reporting and analysis across various business units.

Your Responsibilities


Drive business strategy by engaging with key stakeholders to understand the business vision, requirements & priorities and help to translate this into actionable insights
Analyze data to drive meaningful insights on consumer behavior, consumer’s financial needs, attitudes, pricing, revenue management, modeling and AI
Model, build, and maintain scorecards for different parts of the business using our BI tool
Collaborate with the other analysts to support product, marketing, sales and finance teams with ad hoc analysis and reporting
Support in developing and maintaining our data model by understanding key data sources and relationships between them


Your Qualifications


1-2 years’ of relevant work experience at an internet / ecommerce company (including co-ops and internships) required
Post-secondary degree: We value intelligence over relevance, but a Bachelors in Computer Science would be looked upon favorably
High proficiency with SQL for data analysis
Some knowledge of BI & reporting tools e.g. Looker, Tableau, Sisense, QlikView
Knowledge of Python or R is considered an asset
Experience with a web analytics tool to support product and marketing analysis will be an asset
Exposure to cloud infrastructure such as AWS, Azure or GCP is nice to have


BEYOND THE TECHNICAL YOU ARE:


Strong Analytical Skills
Detail oriented: High standard of data quality and integrity
Resourceful: You don’t have all the answers, but you know how to get them
Strong problem-solving skills and critical thinking abilities
Adaptable to a fast paced environment and able to pivot quickly to align with changing priorities


CULTURE FIT:


No Ego: No task is too big or small. You are never afraid to ask questions when you are trying to learn and understand things. You have no problem rolling up your sleeves and helping to execute when the team needs help. This humility extends to all aspects of your work and interaction with teammates
Player Coach: You mentor and teach as you execute. You model the behaviour you expect from your team. You don’t just tell others what to do, you know and show how to do it at a high standard
Growth mindset: You have a desire to always continue to grow and learn. This means a willingness to get outside your comfort zone and try new things because you view these as opportunities to gain skills and knowledge
Helping Hand: You always offer to help without having to be asked. You go the extra mile to help out regardless of your team and function
Get S##T Done: Your bias is towards action. This means pitching in and rallying to get things across the finish line. Rather than putting off work ask yourself what you can do today to move the needle on a project or goal
Digs Deep: You aren't afraid to ask questions because you want to understand every issue so that you can properly solve the root cause of the problem instead of just completing the task you are given


JOB PERKS:


Competitive salary: We know life is expensive
Flexible hours: Enjoy a couple more hours of sleep in the morning, if you want
Benefits: Health is wealth! A benefits package with no employee contribution required
Perks: RRSP matching program, individual training allowance, access to financial literacy training and resources
Casual dress code: If it’s good enough for you, it’s good enough for us
Fun team socials


Ratehub welcomes and encourages applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Title: Junior Data Analyst Intern
Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Junior Data Analyst Intern to join our client's team for a 4-6 week internship. This internship is designed to provide hands-on experience and training in data analysis, visualization, reporting and to get the selected candidates ready for the market with the relevant expertise in their respective fields.

Responsibilities:


Assist in collecting, organizing, and analysing data
Learn to create data visualizations and reports using tools like Excel, Tableau, or Power BI
Support data quality control and data cleansing efforts
Assist in developing and maintaining databases and spreadsheets
Learn to identify trends and insights from data
Collaborate with team members to understand business needs and develop solutions



Requirements


Currently pursuing or have completed a degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or related field
No prior experience necessary - we're looking for eagerness to learn!
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Basic understanding of statistical concepts and data analysis principles
Proficiency in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel
Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and meet deadlines



About Us:

Onedersquad is a dynamic recruitment and staffing company dedicated to connecting top talent with leading organizations. Our team of expert recruiters specializes in matching exceptional candidates with rewarding career opportunities. With a passion for building lasting relationships and a commitment to excellence, we empower individuals and businesses to reach their full potential.
