Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Join our Canadian reinsurance company and help us empower and advance our mutual insurance community!




We have an excellent opportunity to join one of Waterloo Region’s top employers as a Data Analyst in our Innovation department. With this position, you will have the opportunity to join a culture that takes pride in being honest, delivering on promises and is committed to doing what is right.




This position offers a hybrid work schedule.




The Role:

The Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining current dashboards and assisting the development of new dashboards, charts, and visual aids to analyze data and enable decision making. This includes data profiling and analysis, data cleansing and quality review, and the development of ETL packages for Data transformation, where required. In this role, the data analyst will work on a small team alongside a data engineer, digital architect, and senior data analyst to build new Data & Insights capabilities at Farm Mutual Re.




The successful candidate can expect to:

Assist in preparing and delivering current annual, semi-annual, quarterly, and monthly reports for internal and external partners
Maintain and update data dashboards, charts, and visual aids to support decision making
Analyze data to answer key questions from business partners, growing and building an understanding of what drives business performance
Assist with the design, development and monitoring of data pipelines, transformations and/or data modelling, including constructing ETL packages for Data Transformation and Integration between different applications
Support the creation of templates and documentation, including a data dictionary and data catalogue, and other templates as required to build new Data & Insights capabilities




Your Skills and Qualifications:

You have a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or a related field.
You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst experience with a foundation in data modelling & analytics
Experience with data visualization tools such as Qlik, PowerBI and Tableau
Some experience with data languages such as SQL, Python, R and Excel
Analytical abilities to compile, structure, examine, analyze, and present datasets
Have an understanding of SDLC and Agile Frameworks
Proven data analytic skills, including data mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization




Join Our Team!

Recognized as one of Waterloo Area’s Top Employers 2024 as well as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers 2024, at Farm Mutual Re we are committed to inclusion for all and cultivating belonging where everyone can be their authentic and best selves.




Operating since 1959, Farm Mutual Re is a general reinsurer, sharing in the property, automobile, liability, and other risks originally accepted by insurance companies operating principally in Canada.

We’re passionate about empowering and supporting our employees and business partners. Our relationships are the foundation that helps us advance the mutual insurance community. We take pride in giving back to our community and the environment. We hold ourselves accountable for the promises we make to our members, employees, and valued business partners.




Our office is in Cambridge, Ontario off the 401 in a state-of-the-art, environmentally friendly building. Our employees enjoy perks including complimentary access to an on-site gym, a variety of fitness classes and wellness sessions, as well as the flexibility to work remotely as we embrace the modern hybrid work environment. Our culture is supportive of achieving a balanced and healthy lifestyle. In addition to a great working environment, we invest in our employees continued professional development, offer a competitive salary, employer-paid benefits, pension plan and more.




How to Apply:

Don’t miss this opportunity to join our team. Visit our website and complete our Employment Application found on our Careers page.




In accordance with our company values, Farm Mutual Re is committed to creating an equitable, diverse, and inclusive work environment for all as well as to providing accommodations and achieving a barrier-free workplace. Should you require an accommodation to participate in our recruitment process, please contact recruitment@farmmutualre.com.

Show more
HTML:
Join our Canadian reinsurance company and help us empower and advance our mutual insurance community!


We have an excellent opportunity to join one of Waterloo Region’s top employers as a Data Analyst in our Innovation department. With this position, you will have the opportunity to join a culture that takes pride in being honest, delivering on promises and is committed to doing what is right.


This position offers a hybrid work schedule.


The Role:

The Data Analyst is responsible for maintaining current dashboards and assisting the development of new dashboards, charts, and visual aids to analyze data and enable decision making. This includes data profiling and analysis, data cleansing and quality review, and the development of ETL packages for Data transformation, where required. In this role, the data analyst will work on a small team alongside a data engineer, digital architect, and senior data analyst to build new Data & Insights capabilities at Farm Mutual Re.


The successful candidate can expect to:

  • Assist in preparing and delivering current annual, semi-annual, quarterly, and monthly reports for internal and external partners
  • Maintain and update data dashboards, charts, and visual aids to support decision making
  • Analyze data to answer key questions from business partners, growing and building an understanding of what drives business performance
  • Assist with the design, development and monitoring of data pipelines, transformations and/or data modelling, including constructing ETL packages for Data Transformation and Integration between different applications
  • Support the creation of templates and documentation, including a data dictionary and data catalogue, and other templates as required to build new Data & Insights capabilities


Your Skills and Qualifications:

  • You have a Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering or a related field.
  • You have at least 3 years of experience as a Data Analyst experience with a foundation in data modelling & analytics
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Qlik, PowerBI and Tableau
  • Some experience with data languages such as SQL, Python, R and Excel
  • Analytical abilities to compile, structure, examine, analyze, and present datasets
  • Have an understanding of SDLC and Agile Frameworks
  • Proven data analytic skills, including data mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization


Join Our Team!

Recognized as one of Waterloo Area’s Top Employers 2024 as well as one of Canada’s Greenest Employers 2024, at Farm Mutual Re we are committed to inclusion for all and cultivating belonging where everyone can be their authentic and best selves.


Operating since 1959, Farm Mutual Re is a general reinsurer, sharing in the property, automobile, liability, and other risks originally accepted by insurance companies operating principally in Canada.

We take pride in giving back to our community and the environment. We hold ourselves accountable for the promises we make to our members, employees, and valued business partners.


Our office is in Cambridge, Ontario off the 401 in a state-of-the-art, environmentally friendly building. Our employees enjoy perks including complimentary access to an on-site gym, a variety of fitness classes and wellness sessions, as well as the flexibility to work remotely as we embrace the modern hybrid work environment. Our culture is supportive of achieving a balanced and healthy lifestyle. In addition to a great working environment, we invest in our employees continued professional development, offer a competitive salary, employer-paid benefits, pension plan and more.


How to Apply:

Don’t miss this opportunity to join our team. Visit our website and complete our Employment Application found on our Careers page.


In accordance with our company values, Farm Mutual Re is committed to creating an equitable, diverse, and inclusive work environment for all as well as to providing accommodations and achieving a barrier-free workplace. Title: Data Analyst, Reporting
Description:
Join Hotspex Media!

🙌 #1 Ranked Media Buying and Planning Agency on Clutch.co

🔥 Finalist 'Best AI Tool', 2024 Digiday Technology Awards

🎉 Deloitte Fast 500

Job Summary

Hotspex Media Agency seeks an experienced Data Analyst specializing in web analytics reporting to join our innovative team. This role requires a seasoned professional with over 2 years of experience in digital analytics and reporting, particularly with GA4 and Adobe Analytics. The successful candidate will play a crucial role in our data-driven decision-making processes, spearheading the creation and maintenance of insightful reports that support our clients' marketing strategies.

Job Responsibilities


Spearhead the creation and maintenance of comprehensive analytics reports using GA4 and Adobe Analytics to support various digital marketing campaigns.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify key metrics, performance indicators, and develop custom reporting solutions.
Conduct advanced data analysis to provide actionable insights and strategic recommendations for campaign optimization.
Design and implement automated reporting processes to streamline data collection and presentation across multiple analytics platforms.
Perform regular audits of reporting methodologies to ensure accuracy, consistency, and alignment with evolving analytics best practices.
Mentor junior team members on analytics tools, methodologies, and best practices.
Present data insights and recommendations to internal teams and clients, translating complex analytics into actionable business strategies.


Required Skills


Bachelor's degree in Marketing, Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, or a related field.
Minimum of 2 years of experience in digital analytics and reporting, with proficiency in both GA4 and Adobe Analytics.
Advanced knowledge of digital marketing concepts, web analytics, and data visualization techniques.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a proven track record of deriving actionable insights from complex datasets.
Expertise in data visualization tools such as Google Data Studio, Tableau, or PowerBI.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with BigQuery for advanced data analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience managing multiple projects and prioritizing effectively in a fast-paced environment.
Demonstrated ability to stay current with evolving analytics technologies and methodologies.


Our Values:

We know our people are what allows us to achieve all that we do and that’s why it’s important that everyone we bring onto our team lives our values with us.


🦁 Courage
1️⃣ One Team
💪 Resilience
🚀 Empowerment


Hotspex Media Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in its workforce.

Title: Data Analyst - GCP
Description:
About TCS:




Tata Consultancy Services is an IT services, consulting, and business solutions organization that has been partnering with many of the world’s largest businesses in their transformation journeys for over 55 years. Its consulting-led, cognitive powered portfolio of business, technology, and engineering services and solutions is delivered through its unique Location Independent Agile™ delivery model, recognized as a benchmark of excellence in software development. A part of the Tata group, India's largest multinational business group, TCS has over 615,000 of the world’s best-trained consultants in 55 countries. The company generated consolidated revenues of US $27.9 billion in the fiscal year ended March 31, 2023, and is listed on the BSE and the NSE in India. TCS' proactive stance on climate change and award-winning work with communities across the world have earned it a place in leading sustainability indices such as the MSCI Global Sustainability Index and the FTSE4Good Emerging Index.




Skills and Responsibilities:

•Hands on experience’ work experience working with Google Cloud Services like Big Query, Dataflow, Data Proc, Cloud Functions, Cloud Data Fusion, Cloud Composer etc.

•Responsible & accountable for doing requirement gathering and creation of high level and detailed technical design

•Developing data ingestion framework for different sources

•Strong migration experience of Hadoop cluster to Google Cloud

•Ability to suggest optimal architectural solution on GCP to customer

•Strong knowledge in SQL, Java\Python

•Certified as Professional Data Engineer – GCP

•Good Communication skill

•Exposure to Hadoop ecosystem

•Prior working experience as Data Analyst or similar project.

•GCP knowledge and tools like Tableau / BI / Looker will be addition to this Role.

•Managing Data Analyst role, Compare data and match against the requirement.

•Analyzing various sources of data and comparing with target data.

•Responsible & accountable for doing requirement gathering and creation of high level and detailed technical design.







Tata Consultancy Services Canada Inc. is committed to meeting the accessibility needs of all individuals in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA) and the Ontario Human Rights Code (OHRC). Should you require accommodations during the recruitment and selection process, please inform Human Resource.

Thank you for your interest in TCS. Candidates that meet the qualification for this position will be contacted within a 2-week period. We invite you to continue to apply for other opportunities that match your profile.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Location Address: Toronto, ON Hybrid (Twice a week)
Contract Duration: 4-6 week duration with Possibility of Extension and conversion into FTE
Schedule Hours: 9am-5pm, Monday-Friday
 
Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:
• Strong Knowledge of IBM Infosphere DataStage with at least 4 Years of Hands on Experience.
• Previous experience with design and building scalable DataStage Solutions.
• Previous experience monitoring DataStage Jobs and identified bottlenecks in Data Processing Pipeline
• Prior experience in working with Different Data formats - Flat Files, DB, XMLs, JSON, Python, Hive etc.

• Previous Financial Institution Experience an asset

• Prior Test and troubleshooting experience with problems in system designs and processes.

Soft Skills:
• Demonstrated ability to be flexible/ adaptable in exercising judgment in a changing environment and to manage competing priorities
• Great communication skills are required, as they will regularly be communicating internally and externally

Title: Data Analyst - Fully remote
Description:
Scandinavian Building Services has been a Canadian leader in retail and commercial cleaning for the last 60 years. Starting as a small family owned and operated business in Edmonton Alberta in 1982 to offering full service janitorial and building maintenance across Canada today. We attribute our success to staying true to our core values of Service, Motivate, Respect, and Connect. As we continue to grow we are looking to add a Data Analyst to the Scandi Family!




** Please note candidates must be currently based in and legally able to work in Canada to be considered for this position **




What’s in it for you:

Awarded one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies: We’re committed to a high level standard of excellence for both clients and our Scandi Family.
Growth Opportunities: A place to hang your hat. We want our employees to grow with us long term.
Stability and Job Security: Even through tough economic times we’ve continued to steadily grow, and we aren’t slowing down any time soon. With a strong national presence across Canada
Family First Culture: We are and have always been a family owned and operated business. We have family friendly events year-round and affectionately call our team members the Scandi Family.
Benefits: We offer a comprehensive medical and dental plan as well as personal days off.




What your day to day will look like:




Working permanently fully remote you will be reporting directly to our Business Intelligence Reporting Manager. Working Monday to Friday 8am – 4:30pm EST.




Review, monitor, and analyze various reports including; KPI compliance on operational targets and compliance audits on all daily reports.
Improving Excel reporting templates for maximum efficiency on a continuous basis.
Maintain and edit KPI dashboards in Power BI on a continuous basis.
Utilizing field driven operational data from our industry specific system Lighthouse and following up with Account Manager on specific reports when needed.
Compile and forward reports on an ad hoc basis when needed.
All other duties as required.




What you’ll need to succeed:

Minimum of 2 years experience in a previous Data Analyst role with previous experience with Power BI. Working with KPI’s, large scale data analysis, data cleansing and data reconciliations from multiple sources.
Post secondary education; diploma or degree in a relevant field. Happy to consider a mix of experience and education.
Must have advanced level Excel skills.
Strong knowledge of systems and data integrity.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to demonstrate a sense of urgency in completing tasks.




What you can expect for our interview process:

20 minute preliminary phone interview with our Recruiter
20-40 minute assessment (depending on optional practice questions or breaks)
30 minute MS Teams video interview with the Hiring Manager and direct Supervisors for the role




At Scandinavian Building Services we are an equal opportunity employer who values a diverse workplace. We recognize the strength that comes from different experiences, backgrounds and perspectives and welcome all candidates to apply. We feel it is important that all people have access and opportunity to be employed, to be valued and to be respected.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
WOW 1 DAY PAINTING is looking for a Data Analyst in Vancouver or Toronto to join our growing team! Working cross-functionally with the Marketing, Technology and Operations teams, you will support the team with various reporting needs.

We are looking for someone with strong reporting and analytical skills who can support decision-making by offering strong insights from new and existing data sources. WOW 1 DAY PAINTING is an exciting, fast-growing House detailing franchise, part of O2E Brands, the parent company of the hugely successful 1-800-GOT-JUNK?

When we say It’s All About People, we mean it. We have created a hybrid work model that helps us get together to Collaborate, Celebrate and Connect while enjoying the flexibility of working where it makes sense for you. For this role’s duty and responsibility, we anticipate that you will be in the office 25% of the time.

Day in the Life


Cross Functional Collaboration: Engage with all areas of the brand, including marketing, finance, sales center, and operations, to organize, analyze and report on data across departments. Liaise with technology teams to help support business initiatives, adding clarity to technology requirements and communicating priority related to support requirements for data.Collaborate and coordinate data request processes to ensure requested audiences, segmentations, and exclusions are clearly defined and understood.
Reporting: Design, develop, maintain and optimize reports and dashboards. Create ad hoc reports measuring the performance of strategic initiatives. These initiatives may include projects within our digital roadmap, marketing campaigns and customer journey funnels.
Analysis: Provide fact-based, data-driven insights and analysis to formulate meaningful conclusions and recommendations. Identify trends in the data and proactively concisely communicate them. Develop KPI measures to track achievement. Build, test, and run SQL queries to deliver data extracts for analysis needs. Build or edit data views in the data warehouse.
Data Governance: Identify and support standardization of key performance indicators to measure and support new and existing business initiatives. Support standardization of Goal tracking and input tools (Google Sheets) among business units. Partner with data stewards and data owners by monitoring and drawing attention to real or potential data quality issues.". Partner with the data warehouse manager to ensure customer records in both marketing automation platforms and POS (Salesforce) are cleansed and that segmentation is intact
Technology: Tableau Online server, user and content management. Supporting Data Flows, identifying and resolving errors in daily updates for key sources. Salesforce report development (not administration). Explore data at the source (warehouse) to validate and inform data engineering requests.


What You Bring To The Table


Proficiency in SQL
Experience with BI tools such as Tableau and Power BI. Tableau certification preferred.
Detail-oriented, with the ability to manage multiple projects


Compensation & Benefits


Salary is $ $53,000 to $66,000 (The actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience, and internal parity).
The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health and dental. Focus on your development through our professional development programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness initiatives, including access to gym facilities at our corporate head office. Please speak to us to learn more about what we offer.


About Us

Did you know O2E Brands has been voted one of the Best Workplaces in Canada 15 times!? Take a sneak peek into why that is, here: (YouTube) Check us out on social! At O2E Brands, we know that great talent comes in many forms, and we want to meet you at your best. We will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities at any time throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please contact our Talent Acquisition Team at talentacquisition@o2ebrands.com or notify the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with if unique arrangements will enable your equal participation.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

Business Data Analyst




About Toyota Financial Services

Toyota Financial Services (TFS) provides retail, leasing and dealer financing services to Toyota and Lexus dealerships and customers across Canada. TFS is a member of Toyota Financial Services Corporation (TFSC), a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation in Japan with the Canadian operation headquarters in Markham, Ontario




What Sets Us Apart?

At Toyota Financial Services (TFS), you will help create best in class customer/dealer experiences in an innovative, collaborative and team focused environment. TFS is an important part of the Toyota family, an award-winning global company, recognized worldwide for our technological leadership and superior standards of quality, continuous improvement, and environmental responsibility.




TFS currently has an exciting permanent opportunity as a Business Data Analyst in the Business Analytics Department, reporting to the Manager, Data Governance and Business Analytics. This role will support the development, enhancement and maintenance of the company’s data warehouse and help business users derive actionable insights using data and analytics. This role will reside in our Markham Head Office.




What You’ll Be Doing:

Serve as a bridge between our business users and data warehouse developers to define user requirements and ensure the successful implementation of enhancements to our data warehouse, including:
Research and analysis of available data.
Clarification of the data transformations required to produce desired metrics.
Documentation of business requirements, including recommendations for the design and functionality of reports.
Monitor efficient transition of business requirements to technical specifications.
Design, direction and sometimes execution of UAT.
Support business users on data warehouse issues. Analyze and resolve issues in a timely manner.
Respond accurately and in a timely manner to ad hoc requests for data inquires and analyses.
Work with department managers and HR to design and deliver training to raise competency levels in using data, including data warehouse tables and data, new reports and enhancements, SQL, and Tableau.
Improve access to data while supporting the strengthening of data governance to ensure that data is properly managed, including data security and data integrity.
Monitor daily file transmission status and respond quickly to transmission or data issues to ensure the daily update of data warehouse is completed on time.
Prepare monthly, weekly and daily files and/or reports for Data Warehouse updates and business needs.
Prepare documentation of policies and procedures surrounding the development and maintenance of our data warehouse environment.
Support the rollout of Tableau across the organization and various business analytics initiatives.
Have a continuous improvement mindset and collaborate with other business teams to advance data and analytics capabilities across the organization.




What You’ll Bring:

A bachelor's degree with a quantitative focus in an applied context involving manipulation of data (e.g. applied mathematics, data science, computer science, economics, or statistics).
2-5 years of demonstrated experience in working with data warehousing, data mining and analysis, relational database management system concepts, reporting and how to elicit and interpret user requirements.
Advanced knowledge and experience using MS Excel, SQL, and a Business Intelligence tool such as Tableau to analyze data and create reports for different lines of business (e.g. proficiency with operational and financial data, database functions, able to create and modify tables and forms, able to create programming logic to produce metrics used in analysis and reports).
A working knowledge of financial data and accounting concepts is an asset.
An understanding of business process design and reengineering is an asset.
Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
Team oriented, flexible and proactive.
Candidate must have initiative and ability to work without supervision as well as a strong desire to learn.




What We’ll Bring:

A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect
Competitive salary including bonus
Health and dental benefits effective immediately.
Company pension plan with matched contribution
Associate vehicle discount program
Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement
Fitness reimbursement
Competitive time off benefits
Great company culture-Respect for people and continuous improvement is at our core
Hybrid work environment




What You Should Know:

Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business. Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Job Description

Business Data Analyst


About Toyota Financial Services

Toyota Financial Services (TFS) provides retail, leasing and dealer financing services to Toyota and Lexus dealerships and customers across Canada. TFS is a member of Toyota Financial Services Corporation (TFSC), a wholly owned subsidiary of Toyota Motor Corporation in Japan with the Canadian operation headquarters in Markham, Ontario


What Sets Us Apart?

At Toyota Financial Services (TFS), you will help create best in class customer/dealer experiences in an innovative, collaborative and team focused environment. TFS is an important part of the Toyota family, an award-winning global company, recognized worldwide for our technological leadership and superior standards of quality, continuous improvement, and environmental responsibility.


TFS currently has an exciting permanent opportunity as a Business Data Analyst in the Business Analytics Department, reporting to the Manager, Data Governance and Business Analytics. This role will support the development, enhancement and maintenance of the company’s data warehouse and help business users derive actionable insights using data and analytics. This role will reside in our Markham Head Office.


What You’ll Be Doing:

  • Serve as a bridge between our business users and data warehouse developers to define user requirements and ensure the successful implementation of enhancements to our data warehouse, including:
  • Research and analysis of available data.
  • Clarification of the data transformations required to produce desired metrics.
  • Documentation of business requirements, including recommendations for the design and functionality of reports.
  • Monitor efficient transition of business requirements to technical specifications.
  • Design, direction and sometimes execution of UAT.
  • Support business users on data warehouse issues. Analyze and resolve issues in a timely manner.
  • Respond accurately and in a timely manner to ad hoc requests for data inquires and analyses.
  • Work with department managers and HR to design and deliver training to raise competency levels in using data, including data warehouse tables and data, new reports and enhancements, SQL, and Tableau.
  • Improve access to data while supporting the strengthening of data governance to ensure that data is properly managed, including data security and data integrity.
  • Monitor daily file transmission status and respond quickly to transmission or data issues to ensure the daily update of data warehouse is completed on time.
  • Prepare monthly, weekly and daily files and/or reports for Data Warehouse updates and business needs.
  • Prepare documentation of policies and procedures surrounding the development and maintenance of our data warehouse environment.
  • Support the rollout of Tableau across the organization and various business analytics initiatives.
  • Have a continuous improvement mindset and collaborate with other business teams to advance data and analytics capabilities across the organization.


What You’ll Bring:

  • A bachelor's degree with a quantitative focus in an applied context involving manipulation of data (e.g. applied mathematics, data science, computer science, economics, or statistics).
  • 2-5 years of demonstrated experience in working with data warehousing, data mining and analysis, relational database management system concepts, reporting and how to elicit and interpret user requirements.
  • Advanced knowledge and experience using MS Excel, SQL, and a Business Intelligence tool such as Tableau to analyze data and create reports for different lines of business (e.g. proficiency with operational and financial data, database functions, able to create and modify tables and forms, able to create programming logic to produce metrics used in analysis and reports).
  • A working knowledge of financial data and accounting concepts is an asset.
  • An understanding of business process design and reengineering is an asset.
  • Excellent interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
  • Team oriented, flexible and proactive.
  • Candidate must have initiative and ability to work without supervision as well as a strong desire to learn.


What We’ll Bring:

  • A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect
  • Competitive salary including bonus
  • Health and dental benefits effective immediately.
  • Company pension plan with matched contribution
  • Associate vehicle discount program
  • Professional growth and development programs to help advance your career, as well as tuition reimbursement
  • Fitness reimbursement
  • Competitive time off benefits
  • Great company culture-Respect for people and continuous improvement is at our core
  • Hybrid work environment


What You Should Know:

Our success begins and ends with our people. We embrace diverse perspectives and value unique human experiences. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer that celebrates the diversity of the communities where we live and do business. Applicants for our positions are considered without regard to race, ethnicity, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, religion, or any other characteristics protected by law.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Our mission is to provide a secure, valuable, and sustainable workplace retirement solutions for Canadians. At CAAT, we live our values of integrity, impact, and teamwork every day.




The Senior Data Analyst is integral to the success of the Business Development Research & Data team, and to CAAT’s guiding mission and growth strategy.




This role’s primary focus will be data management and reporting to assist the Pension Solutions team in proactively managing relationships with external organizations and reporting on activities. The role provides additional support in performing research and documenting processes as required.




The role works closely with the Manager, Business Development Research & Data and guides the team’s other analysts and co-op students in a fast-paced environment with concurrent deliverables.




We are looking for someone with:

A degree or diploma in data management, data analytics, statistics, or a related field.
At least five (5) years of experience in data analysis, preferably within the pension or finance sectors.
Experience with Salesforce and either holding or working towards Salesforce certification.
Proven ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently, set priorities, and oversee team projects independently.
Familiarity with CRM tools and/or Power BI is a plus.
Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with advanced Excel skills.
A knack for innovative thinking and problem-solving.
Knowledge of pension plans, group benefits, or labor relations is advantageous.
Strong written and verbal communication skills.




The successful candidate will demonstrate:

Excellent organizational skills with a proactive and solution-oriented approach to task and project management.
Effective communication and training skills, with the ability to convey complex information clearly.
A strategic mindset and resourcefulness in addressing challenges and improving processes.
Dedication to CAAT’s values and organizational culture, including integrity, teamwork, respect, and optimism.




Once here you will:

Guide the team in maintaining, processing, and analyzing stakeholder data, ensuring accuracy and attention to detail.
Train and support new team members and internal stakeholders on tools and processes, providing clear documentation and updates.
Analyze and report on key performance indicators to support strategic initiatives and inform decision-making.
Investigate and implement improvements in Salesforce, working with relevant teams to develop and test new features.
Develop and apply best practices to enhance department efficiency and effectiveness, contributing to process improvements.
Coordinate with internal teams on various projects, initiatives, and training efforts, ensuring effective communication and documentation.
Review and provide feedback on the work of data analysts and co-op students, ensuring high-quality outputs.
Conduct research to address data gaps and support organizational needs, contributing to a comprehensive understanding of data requirements.




Step into CAAT - where your work is both rewarding and meaningful, growth is a constant, fun is the way we roll, and your impact is real! If you meet most of the criteria above, we would love to connect with you.




Our commitment to you as a CAATster:




We’re about growing together and creating impact in a collaborative and caring environment!




Comprehensive & Holistic Care: Your dedication deserves appreciation! At CAAT, we celebrate the complete you, prioritizing your well-being above all. Our all-encompassing employee programs are designed to cater to every aspect of your life and well-being, ensuring you feel cherished and valued. We provide a competitive Total Rewards program based around your physical, mental, and financial wellness. This includes, but is not limited to, your compensation, paid time off, health and dental benefits, wellness programs, wellness incentives, and (of course) a defined benefit pension plan.




Growth Opportunities: Embrace a vibrant, ever-evolving environment at CAAT, where growth is not just a goal, but our way of life! We're expanding and transforming constantly, which means endless opportunities for you to adapt, innovate, and learn. As we grow, so do you. Let’s make a difference together!




A Culture of Collaboration and Fun: We're a team that works, grows, and celebrates together. At CAAT, you belong to a collaborative, inclusive and lively environment that sparks creativity and fosters open communication.




Making a Difference, Together: We're on a mission to secure a better future for Canadians. Your meaningful contributions go beyond the workplace, touching lives and making a significant societal impact. Work that truly counts!




But don't just take our word for it! We’ve consistently been recognized as one of Canada's Most Admired Corporate Cultures, as one of Greater Toronto's Top Employers, and one of the Best Places to Work.

Learn more about us by visiting www.caatpension.ca/careers

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging:

Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) at CAAT means we respect and value the broadest range of experiences, geographies, gender, ethnicities, backgrounds, and perspectives as key elements of our culture. Our vision is to provide an environment where employees can bring their best, professional, authentic, selves to work.




CAAT Pension Plan is an equal opportunity employer, and we will accommodate any needs under the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. Hiring processes will be modified to remove barriers to accommodate those with disabilities, if requested. Should any applicant require accommodation through the application processes, please contact us at hr@caatpension.ca or call Human Resources at 416-673-9000for assistance.

Title: Business Analyst/Data Analyst
Description:
In this dynamic role, you will be responsible for client data ingestion, ensuring seamless integration of external client data to enhance our analytics capabilities and provide valuable insights to our stakeholders. Join us in our data-driven journey.

About The Role

As a Business Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of transforming raw data into actionable insights and innovative products. With a keen eye for detail and passion for problem solving, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the company's data strategy and driving business success

In This Role, Your Key Business Responsibilities Will Include


Identify data product opportunities, including new products and product enhancements, through design thinking sessions and stakeholder engagement
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, such as Technical Accounting, Experience Studies, Valuation, and Inforce Optimization, to gather and document product requirements
Translate product requirements into clear and actionable user stories or product specifications
Develop and implement tactical data products using available tools and support user onboarding
Develop and maintain key metrics to measure product success
Understand L&H Re systems and processes to advise and assist IT in system enhancements and migrating tactical products into strategic ones
Design, map, and code complex and unique client data setups


About The Team

The Data Management & Insights [DMI] team is part of Business Excellence delivering on the promise of a stable end-to-end operating platform for Life & Health Reinsurance [L&H Re]. Their mission is to make client data accessible to stakeholders by systematically acquiring and ingesting it. The team utilizes advanced analytics techniques to generate valuable insights for L&H Re. With a continuous improvement mindset, they strive to enhance data, systems, and processes for both their own use and their stakeholders.

About You

You have proven strategic, analytical, and conceptual thinking abilities. You have effective communication skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to stakeholders clearly and concisely.

Essential Skills


Bachelor of Science degree with 5+ years of relevant experience
Proficient in data mapping, ETL processing, and data integration
Strong understanding of data structures and testing methodologies for onboarding large and complex client datasets
Proficient in SQL, Python/R coding


Nice To Have


Good understanding of relational databases, such as Oracle and SQL Server
Experience in handling large volumes of structured and unstructured data
Familiarity with best practices of data management and governance
Experience working in Waterfall and Agile projects, while leading projects being a plus
Hands-on experience with Data Integration tools (e.g. Palantir) and techniques (e.g. EDA, predictive & prescriptive analysis), and visualization software such as Power BI


Our company has a hybrid work model where the expectation is that you will be in the office two to three days per week on average.

This role will be unable to offer any assistance with relocation or visa sponsorship.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world’s leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

Swiss Re is an equal opportunity employer. It is our practice to recruit, hire and promote without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, pregnancy, sexual orientations, marital status, military status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Decisions on employment are solely based on an individual's qualifications for the position being filled.

During the recruitment process, reasonable accommodations for disabilities are available upon request. If contacted for an interview, please inform the Recruiter/HR Professional of the accommodation needed.

Title: Junior Data Analyst / Analyste de données junior
HTML:
UNCAGE YOUR AMBITION as a

Junior Data Analyst

We are FlightHub Group, an ambitious team of people that created FlightHub and Justfly. Our brands have grown to become two of the top-ranked travel agencies in North America. We now serve over 3 million customers per year, totaling 3 billion dollars in sales, and, whereas the pandemic may have slowed us down a little, we are coming back even stronger. We dream big, pursue passionately, and follow through with resolute self-belief and rigorous commitment. We are a group of individuals sharing a common vision and values, having come together to pursue a collective mission: overtaking the #1 spot in the world.

We are looking for a Junior Data Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for writing queries, analyzing trends, and deriving insights that will help improve the performance of our reservation platform, specifically when it comes to seat selection. By communicating with stakeholders and other analysts, you will provide your findings and insights to ensure our booking processes and the reservation platforms run smoothly, while continuously monitoring dashboards, performing QA tasks and tests, and taking the necessary course of action if problems arise. The ideal candidate for this role is someone who is hands-on and highly analytical, with a business mindset.

Many career paths can prepare you for this life-changing opportunity, but preferably, you’re highly skilled in:

  • Gathering and extracting large data sets;
  • Writing queries (SQL experience required*) to gather and extract large datasets;
  • Using excel to analyze and work with datasets;
  • Solving complex problems and executing best possible solutions;
  • Communicating with various stakeholders, with the ability to work autonomously;
  • Working in a fast-paced and technological environment, with strong communication skills in both English and French.
  • Please note this position is in Montreal, Quebec and on-site

Show us your drive and join our team!

Check us out https://flighthubgroup.com/takeoff

LIBÉREZ VOTRE AMBITION – DEVENEZ

Analyste de données junior

Nous sommes le groupe FlightHub, nous formons une équipe ambitieuse derrière les agences de voyages en ligne FlightHub et Justfly. Nos marques sont devenues deux des agences de voyages en ligne les plus importantes en Amérique du Nord. Nous servons maintenant plus de trois millions de clients par année, et générons au-delà de trois milliards de dollars de ventes, et, même si la pandémie nous a un peu ralenti, l'industrie des voyages recommence à montrer des signes de vie, et le moment est propice pour vous joindre à nous parce que nous en profitons pour revenir encore plus forts. Nous rêvons en grand, nous poursuivons nos objectifs avec passion, et nous avons confiance en notre habilité à les atteindre.

Nous recherchons un analyste de données junior pour rejoindre notre équipe. Dans ce rôle vous serez responsable de l'écriture de requêtes, de l'analyse des tendances et de l'obtention d'informations qui permettront d'améliorer les performances de notre plateforme de réservation, en particulier en ce qui concerne la sélection des sièges. En communiquant avec les parties prenantes et les autres analystes, vous fournirez vos conclusions et vos idées pour assurer le bon fonctionnement de nos processus de réservation et des plateformes de réservation, tout en surveillant continuellement les tableaux de bord, en effectuant des tâches d'assurance qualité et des tests, et en prenant les mesures nécessaires en cas de problème. Le candidat idéal pour ce poste est quelqu'un de pratique et de très analytique, avec un esprit d'entreprise.

De Nombreux Parcours Professionnels Peuvent Vous Préparer Pour Cette Opportunité Unique, Mais De Préférence, Vous Êtes Hautement Qualifiés En

  • Collecte et extraction de grands ensembles de données ;
  • Rédiger des requêtes (expérience SQL requise*) pour collecter et extraire de grands ensembles de données ;
  • Utiliser Excel pour analyser et travailler avec des ensembles de données ;
  • Résoudre des problèmes complexes et mettre en œuvre les meilleures solutions possibles ;
  • Communiquer avec diverses parties prenantes et être capable de travailler de manière autonome ;
  • Travailler dans un environnement technologique en constante évolution, avec de solides compétences en communication en anglais et en français.
  • Veuillez noter que ce poste est situé à Montréal, au Québec et sur place.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
The individual will work in the FRMT(Financial Resource Management Technology) Data Services team within Citi’s Global Functions Technology . The Data Services team is responsible for Data Steward activities that involve liaising with Data owners, Business Treasury and Chief Data Office teams providing business support and ensure proper governance of Citi Data Governance Policy & Standards.

This group is a critical contributor in strategic projects supporting regulatory feedback and influence Citi’s data infrastructure. To this end, we are seeking a Financial Services analyst (preferably with experience from a major US Bank) with 5 - 8 years of experience in regulatory reporting or liquidity management cross-functional programs.

This is an individual contributor , position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. In this role you will have the opportunity to work on solutions to challenging data problems that involve executing on critical aspects of data governance policy. You will also leverage and further develop your leadership skills, as well as build relationships with others throughout the organization. Please see below for further details. If you think this position may be right for you, we encourage you to apply! Our people make all the difference in our success.

Main responsibilities


Participate in the data requirements and issues management process for liquidity regulatory reporting including FR2052a
Participate in the design of Citi’s detective and preventative controls around liquidity data to support data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness
Support committee discussions and working groups that would review and approve liquidity issue remediation and prioritization
Help implement recommendations against liquidity data quality issues that may influence balance sheet and liquidity optimization across legal entities and businesses
Help drive execution of critical aspects of data governance policy and data strategy.
You will partner with data consumers to agree on the scope of critical data quality challenges and ensure that the data operating model is implemented to reduce data risk.
Remediation of issues will include partnering with various business and technology functions. You will help build a deep, comprehensive, and documented understanding of Citi’s key data, data processes, and data flows. Partnering with business data owners will be required to ensure maintenance of key artifacts and overall data quality improvements.
You will be hands-on leading the consolidation of disparate information about the data, as well as ensuring a sustainable understanding of how data flows through operational and analytic platforms and assist Data owner in institutionalizing an enhanced understanding of information assets at an aggregate level, data concept level, and data attribute level.
You will lead initiatives in order to reduce Citi’s data management risks, as well as support the cultural shift toward active data management and ownership.
Identify data quality “hot spots” or points of exposure. Determine strategies to improve data quality controls and monitoring routines to de-risk points of data quality vulnerabilities using CDO approved tools and solutions.
Create or support the creation of data and system flow documentation and process maps. Work to align other key data capabilities including metadata repositories, data dictionaries, data lineage, business process maps, and training materials with the data and system process flows.
Be a trusted and informed advisor/partner to regional teams and lines of business staff members.
Prepare and present status updates and solutions to stakeholders, business partners, and technology teams in a succinct manner to drive decisions and actions.
Lead meetings and working sessions to solve issues, challenges, and risks by factoring input from partners and diverse points of view.
Promote “data as an asset” and influence culture change to make the organization increasingly more data-driven.
Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support
Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned
Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
Interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques to identify trends or patterns in complex data sets
Understanding current data processes and business requirements to help determine new and innovative ways to provide end-to-end solutions .
Qualifications:
2 - 8 years of regulatory reporting, data management or liquidity management experience, preferably in Data Management, Legal, Controllers, Treasury or a Business with an understanding of liquidity-based data, regulatory reporting, analytics, and applicable regulations such as US LCR, US NSFR, and FR 2052a reporting
At least 5+ years of experience in banking and financial services industry, Capital Markets , information technology, and data governance.
5-8 years of relevant experience in business analysis or systems analysis.
3+ years of Data Analysis/ Data Investigation
2+ years of SQL
Proficiency in presentation tools is required
Ability to communicate (both verbal and written) issues in a clear and timely manner to build trusting partnership a wide variety of audiences and stakeholders.
Self-motivated, highly-focused, detail-oriented as well as a team player with high energy levels and the desire to learn and progress within the company.
Knowledge of business analysis procedures and concepts and basic knowledge of other technical areas
Proven analytical, interpersonal and organizational skills
Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
Proven ability to effectively use complex analytical, interpretive and problem-solving techniques
Proven relationship management skills to partner and influence across organizational lines
Demonstrated ability to work on multiple projects in the stream simultaneously
Comfortable working with large data volumes and be able to demonstrate a firm understanding of logical data structures and analysis techniques


Education:


Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience. MBA or CFA Level 1 preferred


------------------------------------------------------

Job Family Group:

Technology

------------------------------------------------------

Job Family:

Business Analysis / Client Services

------------------------------------------------------

Time Type:

Full time

------------------------------------------------------

Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Citigroup Inc. and its subsidiaries ("Citi”) invite all qualified interested applicants to apply for career opportunities. If you are a person with a disability and need a reasonable accommodation to use our search tools and/or apply for a career opportunity review Accessibility at Citi.

HTML:
The individual will work in the FRMT(Financial Resource Management Technology) Data Services team within Citi’s Global Functions Technology . The Data Services team is responsible for Data Steward activities that involve liaising with Data owners, Business Treasury and Chief Data Office teams providing business support and ensure proper governance of Citi Data Governance Policy & Standards.

This group is a critical contributor in strategic projects supporting regulatory feedback and influence Citi’s data infrastructure. To this end, we are seeking a Financial Services analyst (preferably with experience from a major US Bank) with 5 - 8 years of experience in regulatory reporting or liquidity management cross-functional programs.

This is an individual contributor , position responsible for liaising between business users and technologists to exchange information in a concise, logical and understandable way in coordination with the Technology team. In this role you will have the opportunity to work on solutions to challenging data problems that involve executing on critical aspects of data governance policy. You will also leverage and further develop your leadership skills, as well as build relationships with others throughout the organization. Please see below for further details. If you think this position may be right for you, we encourage you to apply! Our people make all the difference in our success.

Main responsibilities

  • Participate in the data requirements and issues management process for liquidity regulatory reporting including FR2052a
  • Participate in the design of Citi’s detective and preventative controls around liquidity data to support data accuracy, completeness, and timeliness
  • Support committee discussions and working groups that would review and approve liquidity issue remediation and prioritization
  • Help implement recommendations against liquidity data quality issues that may influence balance sheet and liquidity optimization across legal entities and businesses
  • Help drive execution of critical aspects of data governance policy and data strategy.
  • You will partner with data consumers to agree on the scope of critical data quality challenges and ensure that the data operating model is implemented to reduce data risk.
  • Remediation of issues will include partnering with various business and technology functions. You will help build a deep, comprehensive, and documented understanding of Citi’s key data, data processes, and data flows. Partnering with business data owners will be required to ensure maintenance of key artifacts and overall data quality improvements.
  • You will be hands-on leading the consolidation of disparate information about the data, as well as ensuring a sustainable understanding of how data flows through operational and analytic platforms and assist Data owner in institutionalizing an enhanced understanding of information assets at an aggregate level, data concept level, and data attribute level.
  • You will lead initiatives in order to reduce Citi’s data management risks, as well as support the cultural shift toward active data management and ownership.
  • Identify data quality “hot spots” or points of exposure. Determine strategies to improve data quality controls and monitoring routines to de-risk points of data quality vulnerabilities using CDO approved tools and solutions.
  • Create or support the creation of data and system flow documentation and process maps. Work to align other key data capabilities including metadata repositories, data dictionaries, data lineage, business process maps, and training materials with the data and system process flows.
  • Be a trusted and informed advisor/partner to regional teams and lines of business staff members.
  • Prepare and present status updates and solutions to stakeholders, business partners, and technology teams in a succinct manner to drive decisions and actions.
  • Lead meetings and working sessions to solve issues, challenges, and risks by factoring input from partners and diverse points of view.
  • Promote “data as an asset” and influence culture change to make the organization increasingly more data-driven.
  • Consult with business clients to determine system functional specifications and provides user and operational support
  • Identify and communicate risks and impacts, considering business implications of the application of technology to the current business environment
  • Act as advisor or coach to new or lower level analysts and work as a team to achieve business objectives, performing other duties and functions as assigned
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.
  • Interpreting data and analyzing results using statistical techniques to identify trends or patterns in complex data sets
  • Understanding current data processes and business requirements to help determine new and innovative ways to provide end-to-end solutions .
  • Qualifications:
  • 2 - 8 years of regulatory reporting, data management or liquidity management experience, preferably in Data Management, Legal, Controllers, Treasury or a Business with an understanding of liquidity-based data, regulatory reporting, analytics, and applicable regulations such as US LCR, US NSFR, and FR 2052a reporting
  • At least 5+ years of experience in banking and financial services industry, Capital Markets , information technology, and data governance.
  • 5-8 years of relevant experience in business analysis or systems analysis.
  • 3+ years of Data Analysis/ Data Investigation
  • 2+ years of SQL
  • Proficiency in presentation tools is required
  • Ability to communicate (both verbal and written) issues in a clear and timely manner to build trusting partnership a wide variety of audiences and stakeholders.
  • Self-motivated, highly-focused, detail-oriented as well as a team player with high energy levels and the desire to learn and progress within the company.
  • Knowledge of business analysis procedures and concepts and basic knowledge of other technical areas
  • Proven analytical, interpersonal and organizational skills
  • Consistently demonstrate clear and concise written and verbal communication
  • Proven ability to effectively use complex analytical, interpretive and problem-solving techniques
  • Proven relationship management skills to partner and influence across organizational lines
  • Demonstrated ability to work on multiple projects in the stream simultaneously
  • Comfortable working with large data volumes and be able to demonstrate a firm understanding of logical data structures and analysis techniques

Education:

  • Bachelor's degree/University degree or equivalent experience. MBA or CFA Level 1 preferred

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re Hiring!

Data Analyst

Toronto, ON

www.socan.com

Full-Time

Remote

Who We Are

SOCAN is a not-for-profit copyright collective dedicated to ensuring music creators and publishers receive what they have rightfully earned for the use of their work. SOCAN supports and represents more than 180,000 songwriters, composers, and music publishers. Through licensing, global royalty collection and advocacy, we help creators to keep making the music that entertains, moves, and inspires us

OUR COMMITMENT TO DIVERSITY, EQUITY, INCLUSION, AND ANTI-RACISM

SOCAN thrives with a variety of viewpoints, identities, and backgrounds, and we are committed to anti-racism. Everyone is welcome to apply for our wide range of roles, regardless of gender identity, gender expression, ethnicity, race, age, culture, sexual orientation, religious belief, or physical ability. Learn more about SOCAN’s commitment to Inclusion & Anti-Racism .

WHY WORK WITH US?


Make a difference by supporting and collaborating with a vibrant and creative community
Enjoy many options for workplace flexibility and work-life balance
Get involved in the rapidly changing creative space
Advocate for and empower the creative community
Together, we’ll help music creators earn more income and make a living


What We Offer


35-hour workweek schedule (possible flexible work options i.e., 4-day work week (position based)
Twelve paid sick days annually (including five personal days)
Virtual My Wellness program, including access to SOCAN’s Toronto fitness facility
Annual Performance Incentive bonus (dependent on a personal and company performance)
Defined contribution Pension Plan
Comprehensive, health and dental benefits program
Inclusive and collaborative working environment


About The Role

SOCAN is seeking a Data Analyst to join our Data Strategy and Analytics team. In this role, you’ll collect, model, analyze and visualize data to enable business strategy and operational efficiency. Working on a centralized team, you’ll operate cross functionally throughout the organization to identify realistic solutions to real time business problems. The ideal candidate is curious, emotionally intelligent, and possesses a drive for continuous learning and self-improvement.


Within the first 3 months you will be expected to understand SOCAN’s high level business model and be able to design and deliver data analysis using various pre-existing datasets.
Within 6 months you must be fully integrated into the analytics team and have independently delivered and end-to-end data analysis / business intelligence solution.
By the end of year one, you’ll be expected to execute analysis projects independently, and become the primary data analysis expert for one or more lines of business


What You’ll Do / Key Responsibilities


Work directly with business users and subject matter experts to document reporting requirements, understand business processes and how they affect data.
Collaborate with developers to design models’ datasets within our cloud data lakehouse environment.
Communicate insights and recommendations to executive leaders by creating clear and concise visual reports and presentations.
Contribute to large corporate projects and initiatives that involve data analytics and reporting.
Identify opportunities for process improvements and data-driven decision-making, while continuously monitoring data quality and integrity.
Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence.


What You Will Bring / Qualifications & Experience


2-4 years of working experience in a similar role
Completion of a post-secondary degree, Preferably in Finance, Economics, Business or a STEM field
Strong quantitative skills with the ability to analyze large data sets, while keeping the big picture in mind
Proficiency performing data analysis using SQL, Python or PySpark.
Demonstrated experience with business intelligence tools such as Power BI or Tableau.
Previous experience leveraging cloud Data Lakehouse’s to build scalable analytical models (i.e. Databricks, Snowflake)
Strong communicator, with a proven ability to tackle loosely defined problems
Fluency in French an asset


Accessibility & Accommodation

SOCAN is committed to providing an inclusive workplace environment that meets the accessibility needs of employees with disabilities. Should you require accommodations please contact us directly at hr@socan.com and we will make the necessary accommodations. Applications submitted to this email address will not be accepted.

EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY

SOCAN is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Hiring and other employment decisions at SOCAN are made without regard to race, colour, religion, sex, ancestry, national origin, ethnic origin, age, disability, citizenship, veteran status, sexual orientation, record of offences, marital status, family status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law, regulation, or ordinance.

If you don’t see yourself fully reflected in every job requirement listed on the posting above, we still encourage you to reach out and apply. Research has shown underrepresented groups often only apply when they feel 100% qualified. We are committed to creating a more equitable, inclusive, and diverse company and we strongly encourage applicants of all genders, ages, ethnicities, cultures, abilities, sexual orientations, and life experiences to apply

How To Apply

If you’re interested in joining us, we’d love to hear from you: http://www.socan.com/careers/

Thank you for your interest in our company; we will be in touch with those candidates we wish to interview.

To learn more about SOCAN, go to www.socan.com . You can also follow us on LinkedIn, X, Instagram, and Facebook (@SOCANmusic/@SOCANmusique).

Apply Now

Title: Velocity - Data Analyst Internship/Co-Op - Winter 2025
Description:
Requisition ID: 205922

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

Term: January 2025 – May 2025

Application Deadline: September 27th, 2024

Ready to Start your Journey with Scotiabank? Apply Now!

For students applying to our internship/co-op or new graduate programs, we do not require resumes! We believe in evaluating you through relationships over resumes and are eager to learn about you, your interests, and your potential.

Please Follow The Steps Below To Successfully Apply

Step 1: Complete your PLUM Profile here and save as a screenshot.

Step 2: Complete a short one-way video interview here.

Step 3: Complete a coding test through Codility to showcase your technical skills by solving job-related problems. Please make sure to have this Codility test completed prior to applying through our career site. When you're ready, click here to begin the assessment.

Step 4: Once you have completed your Plum Profile, one-way video interview and Codility test, apply to the role on our website. Reminder: when the application asks for your resume, instead upload the screenshot of your PLUM Profile!

Note: The one-way video interview & codility assessment for all our Velocity Technology Winter 2025 Internship applications are the same. You only need to complete this one!


To be considered for student opportunities at Scotiabank, Tangerine, and MD Financial you must complete all steps above.


There's no better way to kickstart your career than to do a co-op or internship with Scotiabank! During your work term, you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a winning team, build your network, and discover what you love – all while getting paid to do it! There’s a place for every type of student at Scotiabank and all that we ask for is that you have passion and strong AOO (Attitude, Ownership and Opportunity).

The Velocity Program is not your average internship or co-op! This is a customized experience that focuses on providing you with the development and tools you need to grow your career. After successfully completing a co-op or internship with top performance, we will work with you to establish your future placements. As a result, you will get to learn, grow, and experiment within different areas of both Scotiabank and Tangerine!

Is this role right for you? In this role, you will:


Collaborate with business lines and other stakeholders and identify opportunities to drive business value by leveraging data science solutions
Leverage distributed computing tools (e.g., Spark, Cloud) for analysis, data mining, and modeling
Collaborate with data engineering, software developer, and other analytics teams to build analytical dataset and model
Create and apply model and algorithm testing strategies to measure, conduct testing to measure the effectiveness of models, and make ongoing changes
Prepare detailed documentation to outline data sources, models, and algorithms used and developed
Present results to business line stakeholders and help implement real data-driven changes
Work on challenging and research-based initiatives using advanced machine learning methods focusing on data-driven outcomes
Experiment & learn!


Requirements

Do you have the skills and requirements that will enable you to succeed in this role? – We’d love to work with you if:


You are currently enrolled in post-secondary education.
You love to learn and envision yourself working for an international organization that heavily invests in your future.
You enjoy being involved in extracurricular activities such as conferences, clubs, and hackathons.
You have knowledge/experience in:
Cleaning, transforming, and visualizing large data sets working with various data formats (e.g., unstructured logs, XML, JSON, flat files)
Big Data/Cloud ecosystem (e.g., GCP)
Experimental design, statistical analysis, machine learning
Python programming
Common machine learning libraries in Python, PySpark (scikit-learn, xgboost)
UNIX tools and shell scripting
SQL skills for querying relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, DB2, MySQL)
Visualization tools like PowerBI
Kubernetes
Git Workflows (Pull Request, Code Review, Branching)


What’s in it for you?


You’ll be part of a diverse, collaborative, innovative, and high-performing team.
In-depth training to prepare you for the role, as well as ongoing coaching and feedback to help you succeed!
Exclusive student events such as Scotia Student Day, Lunch & Learns, leadership panels, and much more!
Bank-wide orientation to learn more about Scotiabank and gain exposure to senior leadership across the organization.


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Angular Directions are working closely with a unique company based out of Canada who are looking for a Business Intelligence Analyst to drive their operation in Ottawa. With a dedication to Ecomm Optimisation, Risk Management, and Data Analysis, this company is a proud client of ours and we're delighted to help them find the ideal BI Analyst with strong foundations in SQL and Tableau and a passion for transforming data into actionable insights. Join their dynamic team and help them drive business intelligence initiatives forward.




We are opening our new office in Ottawa in the coming weeks and so any successful applicant will be working 3 or 4 days per week on-site in Ottawa.




We have created an overview of the role and the needs for the role below:




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and maintain SQL queries to extract and analyze data from various sources.
Design, build, and deploy Tableau reports and dashboards to provide insights to stakeholders.
Collaborate with multiple stakeholder groups to understand their business requirements
Support the continuous improvement of data quality and reporting processes.




Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Business, or a related field.
Proficiency in SQL for data extraction, transformation, and analysis.
Experience with Tableau for data visualization and dashboard creation and wider Tableau proficiency, as well as SQL knowledge.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Previously worked with agile project management tools eg. Jira , Trello would be a bonus.
Knowledge of Python or R for data analysis.







What We Offer:

Competitive salary and paid health insurance.
RRSP group benefits savings plan
Hybrid work schedule
Training and tuition reimbursement
New equipment / handwear with up-to-date applications
Opportunities for professional growth and development.
Allowance for monthly commute/ parking
Team building activities
A collaborative and innovative work environment.




We are an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
